column14: Senior Analyst - Permanent, Analytics & Insights – Marketing Analytics, Program Strategy, , Location: Toronto, Canada, , About The Opportunity, , The Analytic & Insights Group at The AIR MILES® Reward Program provides world class analytical solutions through the delivery of insights that enable our clients to build stronger mutually-beneficial relationships with their customers. The group works directly with the sponsors of the program as well as internal business managers to ensure the successful partnering with our clients., , Based in Toronto, we are looking for a well-rounded, best-in-class analytics practitioner with a blend of proficient technical skills and strong business acumen. The Senior Analyst plays an expert role in the application & execution of consumer data and advanced analytics to support the development of customer-centric business strategies and Loyalty Marketing for our clients., , What will you be doing?, Subject Matter Expert in the retail/loyalty industry., Provide strategic recommendations and support to all phases of campaign management (ideation, planning, targeting, list generation, measurement, insights and recommendation) with a focus in pre-analysis and post-analysis., Work collaboratively with internal business stakeholders to fully understand and recommend solutions to business needs and opportunities participating on campaigns development and being responsible for measurements and historical data., Facilitate strategic discussions and provide recommendations based on insights from data analysis., Work collaboratively with internal business partners to clearly define analysis / campaign scope, objectives, targeting & measurement strategy for client’s loyalty marketing initiatives., Own internal client’s relationships, demonstrating expertise on marketing lanes and portfolio, understanding the collector and providing analytical background to develop initiatives and improve targeting, campaigns relevance and response rates., Create case studies to demonstrate how analytics drive revenue, profit or efficiencies for our clients and for LoyaltyOne., Assist in the translation of business requirements into technical specifications., Extract, cleanse and modify raw data from data warehouse, conduct customer analysis or campaign measurement to identify opportunities for clients to maximize the use of AIR MILES Reward Program to drive incremental sales., Present analysis results and recommendations in business language in different forums/meetings., Identify further marketing opportunities for our clients by triangulating industry / competitive analyses with external 3rd party information (research, government reports / trends) and analysis of consumer data., Automate processes and/or make suggestions to tool / process improvement to drive operational efficiency., Develop advanced analytics based on predictive modeling and machine learning methodologies., Ensure timely completion of analysis while maintaining high quality., Balance the demands of multiple concurrent projects while maintaining a high level of diplomacy prioritizing workload based on client value and driving for results., Respond to ad hoc requests (internal & external) for analysis, data and information on a regular basis., Contribute in other corporate strategic initiatives as required., Independently manage select projects & stakeholder relationships., Interpret research, extracting insights, linking to strategies, and communicating a compelling summary of findings and drive results, client communication and presentation, by leveraging the use of effective data visualization systems such as Tableau., What will you bring?, Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in any of the following (or combination of): Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics., Minimum of 3 years of customer analysis / insight delivery experience in a complex data-driven organization., Hands-on experience with Python and SQL; strong analytical & data mining skills; intermediate predictive modeling experience; experience in working with resilient distributed datasets (RDD) and Tableau would be an asset., Business Skills - Expert knowledge in campaign management, marketing, loyalty and customer analytics, multichannel marketing (DM, digital), experimental design, modeling, CRM, segmentation, market research, data analysis, extracting insights, linking to strategies and communicating a compelling summary of findings and drive results, client communication and presentation., Excellent organizational, time management and project management skills., Advanced storyteller with the ability to communicate complex analytics findings in plain business language., , About AIR MILES, , Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. At AIR MILES, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities. AIR MILES is an Alliance Data company. For more information, visit www.loyalty.com, , About ADS, , Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com, , Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation., , Alliance Data participates in E-Verify., , Check us out – AIR MILES on Stack Overflow | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook |Twitter | Blog | Instagram, , Company: AIR MILES, , Primary Location, , CAN - Canada-2084 - Ontario-50419 - Toronto-40-LOY - Toronto, , Work Locations, , 40-LOY - Toronto, , Job, , Analytics, , Organization, , LoyaltyOne, , Schedule, , Regular, , Job Type, , Full-time, , Job Posting, , Apr 7, 2020, 12:03:10 PM, , Division, , Loyalty
column15:
As Canada's most recognized loyalty program, the AIR MILES coalition has more than 200 retailer brands, 100s of online retailers, and two AIR MILES credit card partners. AIR MILES Cards are swiped a thousand times a minute, every minute of every day, 7 days a week, from grocery stores to gas stations to home improvement centers, leading to a reward being redeemed every 3.3 seconds. What that means for our clients is deep, valuable insights that let them connect with their shoppers like never before.

There’s a reason we’re recognized as one of the best places to work year after year: We have an amazing culture thanks to the collaboration, dedication, and fun that our teams bring to work every day. Discover our core values, stay up to date with the latest events at AIR MILES, get to know our people, and find out firsthand what makes AIR MILES such a great place to work.

For more information, visit www.loyalty.com

JOIN OUR TALENT NETWORK https://airmiles.jobs.net/

column14: We are now looking for a Solution Architect to join the America’s Partner Organization focused on HPC, Accelerated Analytics, Deep Learning and Machine Learning solutions with some GPU virtualization too., , If these areas are exciting to you, we should talk. NVIDIA is the world leader in GPU accelerated computing, and is looking for Solution Architects to engage our partners. As a Solution Architect, you will work closely with partners in our North American region - establishing relationships, solving problems with their engineering teams, and helping them build a successful NVIDIA practice., , What You’ll Be Doing, A huge part of the day-to-day job is staying up on the latest improvements in the ecosystem around GPU accelerated environments. You'll also be called on to help architect and scale high-performance computing and virtual workstation environments that incorporate state of the art GPU technology., Document what you know, and teach others. This can vary from building targeted training for partners and other Solutions Architects, to writing whitepapers, blogs, and wiki articles, to simply working through hard problems with a partner on a whiteboard., Answer questions and provide mentorship. Work with Partner Business Managers to assist partners and customers on their mission critical projects. You will help them to build their GPU enabled Accelerated Compute datacenters, and get the most out of their investment., We make heavy use of conferencing tools, but some travel is required for this role. You are empowered to figure out the best way to get your job done, and do what it takes to make our partners successful., Above all, you will be the person that partners call on when they need to get technical in crafting solutions for customers that make use of NVIDIA technology. Backed up by the other Solution Architects, the Engineering organization, and the whole of NVIDIA, you’ll get to be the face and brains of NVIDIA that our partners will learn to rely on., , What We Need To See, BS or MS in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science., 8+ years of work related experience in software development or Machine learning or high-performance computing, GPU and CUDA experience highly desirable., Experience working with DevOps including but not limited to Docker/Containers, Kubernetes and Data Center deployments., Deep understanding of Dense Datacenter design including compute, Storage and networking., Some experience with modern Deep Learning software architecture and frameworks., Experience with supercomputing and technical computing environments, Ability to multitask effectively in a dynamic environment., Strong analytical and problem-solving skills., Clear written and oral communications skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with management and engineering., , Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd, Experience with Deep Learning frameworks, data-heavy applications, C and Python programming, shell scripting, virtualization, cloud services, and Linux, Have a willingness and ability to dig into unfamiliar territories to solve complex problems., #deeplearning
column15: NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, NVIDIA is increasingly known as “the AI computing company.”

column14: We are looking for PySpark Lead for one of our Client in Banking Sector., 8+ years of experience should be Subject Matter Expert in Spark/Hadoop., Understand existing SAS platform and create requirements to migrate to Bigdata/Spark/PySpark., Assign tasks to team and track deliverables., Update task progress and coordinate with clients and onsite team., Good understanding on MapReduce and HDFS., Proficiency with Big Data processing technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Preferably Azure ), Should be expert in Spark memory optimization and performance tuning., Experience in building data pipelines and applications using Python, PySpark & Spark SQL., Create PySpark /Spark jobs for data transformation and aggregation., Data migration experience from Database, SAS datasets to Hive on HDFS., Migration experience from SAS code to PySpark scripts., Migration experience of SAS ML model to Machine learning models using SPARK ML., Produce unit tests for Spark transformations and helper methods., Banking domain knowledge is added advantage., Skills, Mandatory Skills: PySpark-L3, Experience Range: 5-8 YEARS, Desirable Skills:, Azure Cloud Services-L2, , , Requirements Skills, Mandatory Skills: PySpark-L3, Experience Range: 5-8 YEARS, Desirable Skills:, Azure Cloud Services-L2

column14: Engineer, Database, , The opportunity, , As we undertake an exciting new project, EPIC - the transformation of our service and delivery model, we are adding an Engineer, Database to be part of an organization-wide investment in new and optimized technology. EPIC, is a digital transformation project. It is an evolutionary time here as we bring all ownership of IT infrastructure and expertise in-house., , As the first Engineer, Database, this is an opportunity to play a critical role introducing and supporting PaaS and SaaS technology with a focus on enterprise databases; delivering a variety of enterprise systems; and, managing essential systems information and improvements for our business functions., , It’s a chance to help build out the culture of the team and the operational users, establishing relationships of trust and support throughout the organization as you introduce and implement best practices. This is an opportunity to get in at the ground level, build relationships, make impactful changes and grow your career, moving up or laterally into other departments., , Who You'll Work With, , You will report to the Senior Manager Database, SaaS & PaaS, and work closely with the Infrastructure and Application teams across the organization as well as well as both on and offshore teams. You will collaborate across the organization with multiple teams dedicated to introducing a strengthened technology foundation across the organization. This is a nimble team, continuously learning through experimentation, research, and professional development opportunities., , What You'll Do, Build and Operationalize New Systems. You will:, Own and manage the end-to-end build of database systems, including certificates and licenses., Implement, test and remediate non-functional requirements (HA, backup, Alerting, DR, Controls)., Support the development of standard build instructions, “As Built” documentation and operational documentation., Transition build knowledge to operational teams, including ensuring systems meet OTPP operational standards., Configure and Enhances Existing Systems. You will:, Implement, maintain and support the configuration of Teachers database technologies., Provide insights to capacity plans and forecasts., Contribute to the automation of database activities., Track and manage technology assets. You will:, Develop APIs to simplify service consumption by end-users and engineers., Optimize and support existing SaaS and PaaS technologies and data centre based solutions., Minimize system integration complexity while maintaining system reliability and business continuity objectives., , What You'll Need, The education. You have an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Business Studies. TOGAF certification and ITIL Foundations (or equivalent ITSM) certification is preferred., The technical skills. You have hands-on experience with:, Database technologies including Oracle DB, Delphix, MySQL, SQL and OEM., Modern user authentication mechanism., Database platform management and solutions including high availability, disaster recovery, monitoring/alerting, backup and recovery, database performance tuning., The experience. You have 3-5 years related experience including:, Deploying, administering and managing SaaS and PaaS Technology including automation – infrastructure as code., Designing Enterprise Infrastructure Services running various databases and applications., The knowledge. You have a broad and deep understanding of working with global information technology service models and common IT organizational functions, inter-relations, and dependencies., The technical skills. You have hands-on experience with:, Database technologies including MySQL and MS SQL, experience with Oracle DB is a plus., Modern user authentication mechanism., Alerts thresholds and notification., Platform management and solutions including High Availability, Disaster Recovery, Monitoring, Restoring., The drive. You are self-motivated and take ownership of your work and that of your team. You are detail-oriented, organized and analytical. You can innovate solutions to complex problems., The relationship-building experience. You are comfortable working with individuals at any level. You have outstanding written and verbal communication skills., , What We're Offering, Pay for performance environment that offers competitive salary and incentive, Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development, Comprehensive employer paid benefits coverage, Guaranteed retirement income through a defined benefit pension plan, Competitive time off, Discount programs including Edvantage and Perkopolis, Degreed: a digital platform that helps you quickly and easily discover, share, and track ALL kinds of learning resources — from courses to videos to articles and more, , At Ontario Teachers', we are a globally minded organization and take pride ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create reflects and celebrates diversity of thought, background and experience., , If you require an accommodation for the application, recruitment or interview process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs., , How To Apply, , Are you ready to pursue new challenges and take your career to the next level? Apply today!, , We thank you for applying, however, only those selected to continue will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located., , Functional Area, , Information Technology, , Requisition ID, , 1874, , The privacy of your personal information is important to us. Please visit our Privacy Centre to learn how we handle your personal information.
column15:
Our employees make a difference by providing a secure retirement for 329,000 working and retired Ontario teachers. We have established a collaborative environment and seek the free exchange of ideas across the organization in our search for new approaches and solutions to better serve our members. 

Our highly-skilled employees are the reason for our success and talent development is one of the most important tenets of our strategy. At Ontario Teachers’, we look for people who are willing to truly embrace the three cornerstones of our culture: innovation, agility and partnership. We provide our employees with the tools, resources and learning opportunities they need to be the best at what they do – so together we can support our mandate to deliver outstanding service and retirement security to the working and retired teachers of Ontario – today and tomorrow. 

Ontario Teachers’, Canada’s largest single-professional pension plan, is headquartered in Toronto with offices in London and Hong Kong. With $207.4 billion in net assets as of December 31, 2019, we are responsible for providing immediate, personalized services to our members along with investing across a variety of asset classes in virtually every corner of the world.

Read our Linkedin Terms of Use before engaging with us at: http://www.otpp.com/linkedin-terms-of-use

column14: Job Description, , Mackenzie Investments was founded in 1967 and is a leading investment management firm providing investment advisory and related services to retail and institutional clients. The company has $62.5 billion in assets under management, and as part of IGM (a subsidiary of the Power Financial Group of Companies), is the largest independent asset manager in Canada, with $159.4 billion. We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes., , Our Vision, , Everything we do starts with the needs of investors, whether they are saving for a child’s postsecondary education, setting money aside for the future needs of a family member with a disability, or funding their own retirement. In fact, our focus is summed up in our Vision statement: We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes., , Our Values, , Our growth and success are the direct result of our employees, and we strive to create a workplace supported by the following core values: Creativity and Innovation, Strong Decision Making, Collaboration, Courage, Honesty and Integrity, Confidence and Pride., , At Mackenzie Investments you can Build Your Career with Confidence by:, , Changing the Game: We have a vision and a strategy that will challenge the way business in this industry is done and help Canadians be successful in the ways that mean the most to them., , Making a Smarter World: We believe in continuous learning, understanding what is most important and sharing the benefits of that knowledge., , Being Proud: As a part of our team you will do some of your best work, develop some of your most valuable skills and give back in ways that make a difference in the lives of Canadians., , Joining an Unstoppable Team: We build teams that look out for each other, ask the best of each other and deliver the finest work., , Learning and Growing: We offer an environment where you can indulge your curiosity to learn; getting the challenges and feedback you need to refine your skills and abilities., , Thriving in a Supportive Environment: We have created a workplace where your efforts and career are supported by your team and your leader., , The Sustainable, Responsible, Impact Investing (SRI) Team is a newly established function created to build and deliver to clients a range of innovative SRI-focused investment products, solutions and services. This range will cover the spectrum of SRI strategies including ESG integration, exclusion and screening, best in class strategies, thematic and impact investing. In addition, this team will bring ESG expertise to develop and align firm-wide perspectives, to support investments teams to uniquely leverage ESG insights through integration and active ownership, and to reinforce Mackenzie’s commitment to SRI Investing to clients, advisors, and communities., , This newly established team is currently recruiting for an AVP, Impact Investment Solutions to lead the product strategy, implementation, and management of impact-oriented investment solutions. Those solutions include strategies that follow ESG screening, best-in-class, thematic or impact investments. The successful candidate will oversee and manage SRI solutions by having a deep understanding of the competitive landscape, by understanding the needs of clients and by developing and executing on plans that differentiate Mackenzie and its SRI solutions. The incumbent will be responsible for communicating investment strategies, performance outcomes, and portfolio impact measurement to both internal and external groups., , As this is a new role within a newly established function, the ideal candidate will bring a high degree of passion, an innovative mindset, and a clear vision for the business opportunity and the bigger impact that we can make on our company and within our communities. She / he are motivated by their excellent skills to navigate challenging conversations and to be a leader in defining this opportunity space for Mackenzie and for our partners., , The Ideal Candidate Will Be Responsible For, , Product Strategy and Planning (40%), Integrate market knowledge, strategic insight and a strong client focus to help our organization design, develop, and manage impact-oriented solutions, Develop a long-term business plan for the SRI product offering and support P&L activities, Articulate vision and market differentiation for SRI product offering including positioning, go-to-market approach, benefits and value proposition to attract new and retain existing clients, Analyze assets and flows, competitive performance and impact metrics, pricing and positioning, Partner with senior leaders and clients/advisors to develop a range of market growth strategies: product, channel, segment, Develop and communicate expertise on investment industry trends as it relates to SRI solutions, Work closely with Investment Teams and Sub-advisors to align product strategy, Collaborate with mutual fund and ETF strategy and product development teams to ensure SRI solutions are prioritized and launched in a timely manner, Active participation with product launches ensuring internal processes and procedures are integrated and executed, Understand investment strategies, performance, impact and attribution analysis, Implementation and Management (50%), Develop proactive insights, perspectives, product training, and support to sales and marketing teams, Facilitate working sessions to identify questions and hypotheses to ensure our work delivers against our clients’ needs and delivers actionable insights, Participate in thought leadership initiatives: blogging, writing papers, conference presentations, Partner with marketing to create marketing collateral, including content for fact sheets, brochures, or web content with the support of the marketing department. Develop storylines for fund positioning and provide input on public relations, website, sales presentations, and talking points, Coordinate with portfolio management, sales, product, and marketing to ensure and communicate consistent product positioning and messaging, Bring passion to impact-oriented solutions combined with strong knowledge of the investment industry to interpret and communicate investment performance along side product impact measurement, Leadership and Change Management (10%), Collaborate internally and externally to determine barriers and opportunities for SRI solutions and determine an optimal approach to address them, Create and implement change management strategies and plans that maximize the success and focus on SRI solutions, Build and lead a team to support the implementation and management of SRI solutions, Develop and promote SRI initiatives that foster a culture of impact in partnership with key stakeholders, , The Ideal Candidate Will, Bring at least 10+ years of relevant experience and demonstrated leadership skills, Strong investment knowledge of SRI space, capital markets and asset management, Advanced knowledge of Environmental, Social and Governance factors, Comfortable working in autonomy with a builder mindset, Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, Strong analytical and data visualization skills, Strong attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, Proven leadership and organizational skills, Strong strategic thinking, problem solving, analytical / critical thinking skills, CFA preferred, Values and Personal Attributes, Analytical, strategic thinker, Ability to build relationships internally with all levels, Flexible - comfort managing multiple complex tasks at once; prioritizing, Creative, entrepreneurial spirit, Ability to implement – not just analyze, Intellectual rigor, Team-oriented mindset, Warm, friendly, collegial, and approachable, Ability to relate well to all kinds of people, Energetic leader, , Internal Applicants, , If you are interested in applying for this position please direct applications on-line using the “apply for this job” icon located at the bottom or to the left of the posting. If you would like to refer someone for the position please email the posting using the “email this job” option and have your referral indicate that they were referred by you when completing the application. All resumes should be received by June 16 th , 2020. If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact Human Resources. Please record your extension number on your resume and cover letter. The Career Level Framework for this position is P10, , External Applicants, , We thank all applicants for their interest in Mackenzie Investments; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted., , Mackenzie Investments offers an exciting and challenging work environment, a competitive base salary, performance-based bonuses, excellent benefits, recognition for your accomplishments, and opportunities for personal and professional growth., , Mackenzie Investments is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment accommodations in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please advise Human Resources if you require an accommodation., , File # 20-71, , Options, , Apply for this job online Apply, , Share, , Refer this job to a friend Refer, , Sorry the Share function is not working properly at this moment. Please refresh the page and try again later., , Share on your newsfeed
column15:
Mackenzie Investments is a leading investment management firm providing investment advisory and related services to retail and institutional clients. 

Mackenzie’s heritage is one marked by innovation and thought leadership driven by expertise in asset management that creates financial success for investors.

Today, we are building on that legacy with determined energy, forward thinking and innovative, timely ideas. Our progress is fueled by leading minds recruited from world-class institutions. 

With top talent, the stability of strong ownership, and an unwavering commitment to investor success, Mackenzie builds confidence in a changing world.

column14: Opentext - The Information Company, , As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management., , The Opportunity, , We are looking for an experienced Product Manager who is passionate about building products and cloud services that your customers love and that solve real business problems. You will join a dynamic team dedicated to advancing the state-of-the-art in Capture and Recognition technology, including OCR, ICR, document classification, entity extraction and validation., , We look for a charismatic person to lead our capture strategy and define the roadmap for future recognition technologies that are embedded in OpenText products and industry solutions., , Together with R&D and the go-to-market teams, you will drive the design, build and roll-out of products and services which deliver OpenText’s vision and strategy., , You Are Great At, Staying on top of market trends, technology advances and competitive offerings., Creating and maintaining a compelling product strategy, vision and roadmap in the context of our Capture portfolio, and conveying this information to executives as well as to key global customers and partners, Following defined processes to manage software releases from inception to launch and leading cross-functional groups to resolve issues, Collaborating with our worldwide Product Management and go-to-market teams to coordinate product roadmap and support go-to-market activities, Working closely with our global R&D teams to deliver according to roadmap and business plan with short time-to-market windows, What It Takes, 5+ years of software product management experience highly desirable, MS/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent preferred, MBA degree a plus, Proven ability in managing a successful product through its entire lifecycle; both, from a technical and business perspective, Experience analyzing, evaluating and prioritizing numerous enhancement requests across multiple product lines to optimize for company objectives, Ability to quickly learn new technologies and translate technical jargon into quantifiable business benefits; strong communication skills for interacting with business and technical leaders, Experience in agile software development of toolkits and embedded software; ability to prioritize and effectively manage a structured backlog while acting as the Product Owner, Experience in Optical Character Recognition, document classification and data extraction technologies with machine learning, and related technologies is desirable, At OpenText we understand and value diversity in our employees and are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We hire the best talent regardless of sex, national origin, disability or race. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email accommodationrequests@opentext.com.
column15: OpenText, The Information Company™, a market leader in Enterprise Information Management software and solutions, enables intelligent and connected enterprises by managing, leveraging, securing and gaining insight into enterprise information, on-premises or in the cloud. For more information about OpenText (NASDAQ/TSX: OTEX), visit www.opentext.com.

column14: About Toptal, , Toptal is a global network of top talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the largest fully distributed workforce in the world., , We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun (see this video from The Huffington Post). We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold., , Position Description, , Do you enjoy crafting visually stunning dashboards and visualizations with tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Qlik? Do you thrive when you can build reports that influence crucial business decisions by getting the right information into the hands of the right people, at the right time? Our team needs Business Intelligence Report Developers who are self-starters that can prioritize their time, priorities, and multiple projects simultaneously, as well as explain complex issues in a simple and intuitive way. We are not looking for an order taker! We need those who love to undertake problems, think critically and build an independent view on data so that the best possible business outcomes are achieved., , Toptal prides itself on being an organization that focuses on the data. Our BI Report Developers build, support, and maintain reports and dashboards both in a push model and in response to specific requests. This role requires expertise in all aspects of report development, including data sourcing, SQL, report design, data visualization, metric calculation, and intuitive user interface creation., , While this role sits within our new Business Analytics Center of Excellence team, it will support all functions of the business (product, Enterprise, SMB, sales, marketing, operations, finance, and people teams). Together with Data Analysts and Business Analysts, this role will act as an important gatekeeper to drive quality and consistency at Toptal, while building positive relationships and being responsive to functional needs., , This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English., , Responsibilities, Develop both standardized and ad hoc reports supporting all business disciplines using SQL and BI tools (Tableau and Periscope)., Visually represent data in a consumable and actionable way., Pull insights from and formulate use cases around reports and dashboards., Drive consistency across outputs by standardizing report design, metric definitions, and standard methodologies., Solve problems that arise in data, ETL processes, business processes, definitions, and report development., Establish relationships within Business Analytics and with company-wide partners., Instill trust and confidence in produced reports across the organization., Train end-users on how to view/use reports and dashboards and effectively communicate data requirements., Collaborate to build data dictionaries and document definitions, sources, logic, reports, and usage of all metrics and dimensions., , , In The First Week Expect To, Onboard and integrate into Toptal while also learning about Toptal’s history, culture, and vision., Shadow key teams including Growth, Talent Operations, Enterprise, and SMB to learn the core of Toptal’s operations and capabilities., , , In The First Month Expect To, Understand the data generated through company operations and activities, and where/how that data is stored., Understand our current and future data models, key data sets, and key data relationships., , , In The First Three Months Expect To, Develop a proficiency of data elements., Complete an inventory of current reports, dashboards, metrics, and views., Identify duplicates, discrepancies, and out-of-date reports while beginning to develop, standardize, and create a certification of reports., , , In The First Six Months Expect To, Provide an assessment of reporting tools and recommendations on tool selection., Start to transition users away from old reports to certified reports., Contribute to the alignment and standardization of metric definitions across the company., , , In The First Year Expect To, Play a critical part in setting the team up for success., Have established a centralized, certified, official reporting repository as a single source of truth for all key company reports., Collaborate to establish and implement a data security policy., , , Requirements, 3+ years of experience in data science, data analysis, analytics, business intelligence, or reporting., Remarkably proficient in all areas of report development, including SQL, UI design, development, access management, platform management, and strong visualization skills., Outstanding presentation skills., Master at incorporating sometimes complex calculations/logic into simple report outputs., Proficiency with Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, etc.)., Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy and operations to drive real impact., Proven technical background in math, science, engineering, or statistics; Working knowledge of business processes and concepts., A standout colleague that builds strong relationships and establishes trust with business leaders, engineers, and business analytics colleagues., Outstanding written and verbal communication skills., Strong professional skepticism, including the ability to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations and flag blind spots., Work multi-functionally and independently; take ownership of quality, accuracy, and timeliness of work., You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal., , For Toptal Use Only: #individualcontributorSA #bosouthamerica #remote #midwest #canada

column14: Job Description, , At EXP, we know that great experiences start with the right people. We believe that work should be challenging, and the challenge should be fun. We also believe that exponential possibilities are more likely to occur with a respectful, satisfying and empowering company. We value and respect our employees - their experience and expertise as well as their energy, passion and diversity - and their innovative approach to work and to life., , Your Challenge, , EXP is looking for a highly motivated ERP Administrator. The Application Administrator will be responsible for installation, configuration, security, data, workflows, documentation, training and reporting of the Deltek Vision Cloud environment and other related corporate applications., , Your Responsibilities, Responsible for configuring and supporting Deltek Vision and related mobile apps, Member of the implementation team for new Deltek modules (PO, Asset Management, Planning), Develop and modify Vision workflows and user defined components, Develop SQL queries for reporting and updates, Develop documentation and interact with staff on proper Deltek Vision usage, Create and modify custom reports, Manage Deltek Vision security roles, Troubleshoot user issues with staff and Deltek Select Care support, Install and maintain supporting applications such as Elevia software and portal applications, Perform data imports and key conversions, The Skills, Knowledge, And Ability We Seek, Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent experience, 3-5 years of accounting, SQL and related Deltek Vision experience, 3-5 years of experience with Microsoft Office365, Browser, Windows Server, IIS, SQL Server, Experience with the Deltek Vision data schema preferred, Must have the ability to organize assigned work and develop effective work methods, Excellent oral and technical written communication skills, Strong sense of urgency and self-initiative to meet deadlines, Ability to work independently and as part of a team, Ability to effectively assess, inform and make decisions within a general framework, Available to work nights and weekends to complete a project as necessary, About Us, , EXP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer who fully and actively supports equal access for all people regardless of Race, Color, Religion, Gender, Age, National Origin, Veteran Status, Disability, Genetic Information or Testing, Family and Medical Leave, Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity or Expression., , Should you need any special accommodations, please feel free to contact us at hr.support@exp.com and we will arrange for the most suitable accommodations based on your needs., , What EXP Can Offer, , With a mission to understand, innovate, partner and deliver, EXP provides engineering, architecture, design and consulting services to the world’s built and natural environments., , Our heritage dates back to 1906, when the earliest of EXP’s predecessor companies started its engineering infrastructure practice. Today, over 3,000 creative EXP professionals across North America provide the passion and expertise needed to deliver successful projects around the world., , Our promise is to offer you a challenging career in a positive and dynamic work environment, and it is a promise we take seriously., , Join a dynamic team at EXP that provides you with innovative projects, the capacity to develop your career, a full range of benefits, flexible working hours, and much more! When you explore what EXP has to offer, you’ll find exponential possibilities., , For more information, visit www.exp.com ., , About The Team, , EXP is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer who fully and actively supports equal access for all people regardless of Race, Color, Religion, Gender, Age, National Origin, Veteran Status, Disability, Genetic Information or Testing, Family and Medical Leave, Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity or Expression., , Should you need any special accommodations, please feel free to contact us at hrsupport@exp.com and we will arrange for the most suitable accommodations based on your needs.
column15:
With a mission to understand, innovate, partner and deliver, EXP provides engineering, architecture, design and consulting services to the world’s built and natural environments.

Our heritage dates back to 1906, when the earliest of EXP's predecessor companies started its engineering infrastructure practice.

Today, over 3,000 creative EXP professionals across North America provide the passion and experience needed to deliver successful projects around the world.

----------------------

Guidée par sa mission de comprendre, d’innover, de collaborer et de réaliser, EXP fournit des services-conseils et des services complets d’ingénierie, d’architecture et de conception destinés aux milieux bâtis et naturels du monde entier.

L’héritage professionnel d’EXP remonte à 1906, année marquant le début des activités d’ingénierie des infrastructures de la plus ancienne de ses sociétés patrimoniales.

Aujourd’hui, les quelque 3 000 professionnels d’EXP travaillant depuis les quatre coins de l’Amérique du Nord mettent à contribution leur passion et leur expertise pour assurer la réussite de projets à travers le monde.

column14: Project Description, , Applying to the position, you may join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. Our client is a professional investment management organization that invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and currently has offices in Toronto, London, Hong Kong, New York, São Paulo, Luxembourg and Mumbai., Client attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:, Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders, Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment, Accelerated exposure and responsibility, Global career development opportunities, Being motivated every day by important social purpose and unshakable principles, A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance, If you share a passion for performance, value a collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here's an opportunity., , We are seeking an additional consultant to join our Murex Change Delivery team. He/she will work with business and IT stakeholders and partners across the organization to deliver strategic business initiatives and continuous improvements in a front-to-back and cross-asset implementation of Murex which serves as the derivatives book of record., , Responsibilities, - Act a Murex team representative in strategic project activities, Design, develop and implement production enhancements requests from various business teams, Work with the rest of the Murex Change Delivery team to coordinate efforts, provide updates to management, Must be comfortable assessing end-to-end data flows from upstream applications through Murex and to downstream consumers, Provide derivative product knowledge and Murex best practices to a larger project team and internal stakeholders, Maintain and contribute to the internal knowledge management system about derivatives products and Murex, , Skills, , Must have, - 6+ years of experience with Murex and financial markets technology, Technical knowledge of the following areas in Murex is essential:, MXML, Workflow, Market data (RTBS, connectivity), Functional knowledge of the following areas in Murex is essential:, Curves, PL, Sim View, Good understanding of financial markets and products, in particular derivatives across interest rates and equities and emerging markets fixed income, Ability to think logically, analyze and troubleshoot complex problems and drive them through to resolution, Log debugging and technical root cause analysis, Knowledge of SQL query language or experience running queries to extract data from Oracle and Sybase databases, Interpersonal and communication skills with good technical understanding in order to effectively liaise with business users and members of technical teams with minimal assistance., Excellent organizational, facilitation and communication (verbal and written) skills, Highly proactive, self-motivated and self-sufficient with the ability to learn new skills quickly, Experience with Unix / Linux, University or college degree in a related discipline (Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Technology) or equivalent work experience, , Must, , MXML, Workflow, Functional (Curves, PL, Sim View), Funtional (Product knowledge IRD, EQD etc,), Market data (RTBS, Setup), , Good To Have, , Scheduler, Shell scripting, SQL, UNIX (basic), Datamart, JAVA, Nice to have, - Experience with job schedulers (e.g. JAMS, Tivoli, Tidal), Experience debugging and writing shell scripts, Experience with Murex Datamart, JAVA development, , Languages, English: C1 Advanced
column15:
Luxoft, a DXC Technology Company (NYSE: DXC), is a digital strategy and software engineering firm providing bespoke technology solutions that drive business change for customers the world over. Luxoft uses technology to enable business transformation, enhance customer experiences, and boost operational efficiency through its strategy, consulting, and engineering services. Luxoft combines a unique blend of engineering excellence and deep industry expertise, specializing in automotive, financial services, travel and hospitality, healthcare, life sciences, media and telecommunications.

DXC is the world's leading independent, end-to-end IT services company that drives digital transformations for clients by modernizing and integrating their mainstream IT. Together, DXC and Luxoft offer a differentiated customer-value proposition for digital transformation by combining Luxoft’s front-end digital capabilities with DXC’s expertise in IT modernization and
integration. 

Please follow Luxoft for regular updates and insights into our business.

column14: We Are:, , Applied Intelligence, the people who love using data to tell a story. We’re also the world’s largest team of data scientists, data engineers, and experts in machine learning and AI. A great day for us? Solving big problems using the latest tech, serious brain power, and deep knowledge of just about every industry. We believe a mix of data, analytics, automation, and responsible AI can do almost anything—spark digital metamorphoses, widen the range of what humans can do, and breathe life into smart products and services. Want to join our crew of sharp analytical minds? Visit us here to find out more about Applied Intelligence., , You are:, , A hands-on Solution Architect who knows how to develop, design and maintain technologies that work for our clients. You are a next-generation thinker when it comes to what we call Data in the New. Your superpower? Using the latest data and analytics technologies to help clients glean the most value from their data. And you know how to come up with strategies, solutions, and processes for managing enterprise-wide data throughout the data life cycle. You’re a digital native who’s right at home when the challenge calls for teamwork and originality, , The work:, , Understand and translate business needs into data models supporting long-term solutions., Work with the Application Development team to implement data strategies, build data flows and develop conceptual data models., Create logical and physical data models using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy., Optimize and update logical and physical data models to support new and existing projects., Maintain conceptual, logical and physical data models along with corresponding metadata., Develop best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models., Recommend opportunities for reuse of data models in new environments., Perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and SQL scripts., Evaluate data models and physical databases for variances and discrepancies., Validate business data objects for accuracy and completeness., Analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions., Develop data models according to company standards., Guide System Analysts, Engineers, Programmers and others on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces., Review modifications to existing software to improve efficiency and performance., Examine new application design and recommend corrections if required., , Here’s what you need:, 5 to 7 years working as a consultant or directly with clients, 5 to 7 years in a role that had taken ownership of the data assets for the organization to provide users with high-quality data that is accessible in a consistent manner., 5 to 7 years facilitating the development of the conceptual, logical, and physical data models, the implementation of RDBMS, operational data store (ODS), data marts, and data lakes on target platforms (SQL/NoSQL)., 5 to 7 years in a role that discovered captures the current state of the system, encompassing processes such as data discovery, profiling, inventories., 5 to 7 years facilitating the definition of the policies & standards for data management for structured, semi- and unstructured data use, 5 to 7 years in a role that defined the data architecture to oversee and govern the expansion of existing data architecture and the optimization of data query performance via best practices. The candidate must be able to work independently and collaboratively., 5 to 7 years in a role that defined implementation facets with business and IT data requirements through new data strategies and designs across all data platforms (relational, dimensional, and NoSQL) and data tools (reporting, visualization, analytics, and machine learning)., 5 to 7 years in a role that defined the data architecture with focus to, (Business) Data Definitions & Metadata, Reference Data Management, Master Data Management (core & critical business data entities), Data Lineage, 5 to 7 years in a role that had close interaction with business and application/solution teams to implement data strategies, build data flows, and develop conceptual/logical/physical data models, 5 to 7 years performing ad-hoc Data extraction and archival; Managing Data life-cycle., 5 to 7 years experience in a role to define and govern data modeling and design standards, tools, best practices, and related development for enterprise data models., 5 to 7 years experience in a role to identify the architecture, infrastructure, and interfaces to data sources, tools supporting automated data loads, security concerns, analytic models, and data visualization., 5 to 7 years experience in a role to Hands-on modeling, design, configuration, installation, performance tuning, and sandbox POC., 5 to 7 years experience in a role to work proactively and independently to address project requirements and articulate issues/challenges to reduce project delivery risks, 5 to 7 years experience in a role with experience in data warehouse, data lake, and enterprise big data platforms in multi-data-center, 5 to 7 years knowledge in metadata management, data modeling, , , Bonus points if:, Expertise in using Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Pig, Hive technologies, Data Ingestion in Data Lake, Data Storage on key Cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP), Redshift, Data Retrieval on Big Data platforms and Interfacing Data Science and Data Visualization tools on Big Data platforms, Experience in Data Modeling, Big Data Platforms (e.g. Cloudera, Hortonworks, AWS, Talend, etc.), Data Migration and Quality (using ETL e.g Informatica), MySQL/NoSQL, CQRS Event Sourcing, , , Accenture Overview, , We are a global collective of innovators applying the New every day to improve the way the world works and lives. Help us show the world what’s possible as you partner with clients to unlock hidden value and deliver innovative solutions. Empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community of diverse talent and perspectives, we drive success in a new business architecture that disrupts conventional practices. Our expertise spans 40+ industries across 120+ countries and impacts millions of lives every day. We turn ideas into reality., , Important information, , To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired from Day 1, please visit our website at accenture.ca/careers.https://accntu.re/2Hcjdtn, , It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients our employees must be available to travel when needed., , Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces., , We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply., , Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With 469,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
column15: Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. With 505,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.

column14: Who We Are, , State Street Global Exchange combines our unique capabilities in data and analytics to better serve our clients and build relationships with new customers. Through information and insights, investment analytics and data solutions, our goal is to help our clients zero in on the opportunities and actions that will generate the most value. We help them decide on a strategy and put it into action. We offer research and advice that give our clients insight into issues shaping their business today. And we offer information and data management plus analytics to help them plot results and manage risk., , Who We Are Looking For, , The State Street Global Exchange Data Solutions team is seeking experienced, Data Analysts to help us build and sustain our client’s data capabilities and competitive advantage using the GX Data Solutions services and product offerings. DataGX provides its clients with a more effective integration channel with their service partners while reducing both operational and technology cost and complexity, we offer a comprehensive range of solutions and capabilities including: Data as a Service (DaaS), Data Aggregation Services, Value-Added Services such as Data Management Strategy Consulting, Risk Reporting and Virtual Data Marts., , The successful candidate will have knowledge of tools and techniques used for data management; knowledge of database platforms and design and support tools including the ability to write SQL code for strong data analysis through queries, data profiling, and data validation exercises; have experience with metadata management approaches and tools., , Why this role is important to us, , The team you will be joining is a part of Global Exchange (SSGX). SSGX is a State Street business unit that provides data and analytics solutions to asset owners and asset managers, as well as banks and insurance companies. Global Exchange helps our clients make more informed investment decisions. Our broad product line provides a consistent way of looking at risk and performance from front to middle office., , Join us if making your mark in research for investment industry from day one is a challenge you are up for., , What You Will Be Responsible For, , As a Data ManagementGX Service Manager you will, DataGX point of contact for client for all Business As Usual (BAU) related items and discussion, Act as the primary client advocate within DataGX, Work closely with Operations, DataGX SME, and internal service provides (truView, SSIA etc.) to provide optimal service to clients., Track and deliver all Service Level Agreement (SLA) statistics to client, Run periodic BAU calls with client, Actively work on new projects and enhancement to the DataGX service, Keep other players like client service, relationship management teams in the loop, Assist in structuring the data validation process, Examine existing business models and flows of data, discuss findings with the client, and design the appropriate solution for the client, Liaise between the client , data modelers and the developers, Work independently to research and resolve problems considering multiple avenues for resolution, Support and provide analysis for Client Change Request items impacting the Enterprise processes and Operating Models, Interface with data experts, data sourcing resources, Employ analytical, conceptual, and creative thinking skills to improve overall business and systems performance, Support user training, documentation, and rollout, Support overall project management and business strategy related to information delivery, business intelligence and data governance, Maintain effective working relationships with organizational team and clients, , What We Value, , The DataGX service manager is a senior Business Analyst with client facing skill set. As such, these skills will help you succeed in this role:, Excellent decision making, communication, and presentation skills, Must be self-motivated, adaptable and show initiative in different circumstances and under pressure, Excellent analytical skills, , Education & Preferred Qualifications, 5+ years of professional experience working in a related role, preferably within Operations, Must possess a clear understanding of different investment data components and their interaction. Security master, Trade, Positions, analytics, performance, attribution, risk etc., Experience interacting with external or internal clients, Working knowledge of common data vendors (i.e. Bloomberg, IDC, RIMES etc.), Prior experience with State Street and ESP is a big plus, Bachelors/Master’s degree in business, accounting, information technology or related field of study, Knowledge and experience working within financial services, , Additional Requirements, , Flexibility and ability to travel, , About State Street, , What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients., , Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential., , Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspective are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome the candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift program and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you., , State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer., , Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers, , Job ID: R-641887
column15:
At State Street, we partner with institutional investors all over the world to provide comprehensive financial services, including investment management, investment research and trading, and investment servicing.

Whether you are an asset manager, asset owner, alternative asset manager, insurance company, pension fund or official institution, you can rely on us to be focused on your challenges. We are committed to doing what it takes to help you perform better — now and in the future.

column14: Company Overview, , Sysco is the global leader in selling, marketing and distributing food products to restaurants, healthcare and educational facilities, lodging establishments and other customers who prepare meals away from home. Its family of products also includes equipment and supplies for the foodservice and hospitality industries. With over 69,000 associates, the company operates more than 320 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 650,000 customer locations. For fiscal 2019 that ended June 29, 2019, the company generated sales of more than $60 billion., , Sysco, one of Canada’s Best Employers 2019, as listed by Forbes, is dedicated to our global corporate social responsibility goals and to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. Join our winning team., , For more information, visit www.sysco.ca or follow us @SyscoCanada at facebook.com/SyscoCanada; twitter.com/SyscoCanada or instagram.com/SyscoCanada, , For a full list of opportunities, visit www.sysco.ca/careers, , Role, , This role is responsible for creating custom reporting, analytics, and insights for all Field Sales & Marketing programs and initiatives. This includes Corporate and Regional marketing promotions and programs, GSM performance insights, Sysco Rewards, social media, sales technology, Business Resources, training and development, order channels, territory management, fiscal sales planning, and brand/sourcing sales growth initiatives., , Role Responsibilities, Reporting, analytics and profitability analysis for all Field Sales & Marketing programs and initiatives., Provide business insights to support data driven decision making to Corporate leadership and Regional sales leadership., Ability to present data and insights visually to be compelling and actionable for targeted stakeholders., Support the development of regular performance scorecards, period reporting, quarterly market review presentations and annual operating plans., Sysco Rewards Program administration such as analytics, reporting, new item process, IDS utilization, and maintenance. Supplier rewards enrollment and billing process., Supplier relations pertinent to invoicing and reconciliation including Central Billing., Database clean-up and maintenance., Support website and email marketing initiatives including digital delivery, content development, targeted marketing, testing, reconciliation/tracking and maintenance., Support and work with Regional field teams on insights, tracking and benchmarking., Optimizing existing reporting and processes., Is willing to work safely with minimal environmental impact and understands the importance of reporting all hazards, incidents, and environmental spills immediately to their Supervisor., Understands that they play an integral role in their own safety and that of their colleagues and is willing to speak out when hazards are present, Other Field Sales, Marketing and analysis/insights responsibilities as required., , Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements, , A minimum of three (3+) years job related experience, with experience in a marketing and/or analytical role preferred., Completion of post-secondary education in Data Science, Business Administration, Marketing, Commerce or related degree., Advanced proficiency using Excel, Word, and PowerPoint with the ability to learn rapidly as required., Proficiency in enterprise reporting tools – COGNOS and Tableau., Proficiency in digital analytical reporting tools including Google Analytics., Experience in website administration, data testing and optimization., Understanding of graphic packaging and web design., Understanding of Salesforce.com platform or similar CRM tools., Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills with an ability to build relationships at all levels and across functions., Ability to complete multiple work assignments under tight deadlines and agility to adapt priorities., Understanding of basic financial reporting and accounting procedures., , Internal candidates apply via the Career Centre on your HR Portal / ADP Workforce Now., , External candidates submit cover letter & resume via www.sysco.ca/careers, , Sysco’s Values: Integrity | Excellence | Teamwork | Inclusiveness | Responsibility, , Sysco’s Vision is to be our customers’ most valued and trusted business partner., , We offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds expectations., , Sysco is committed to Employment Equity. Accommodations during the recruitment process are available upon request for candidates with disabilities., , Here’s a sample of the many benefits Sysco associates enjoy:, , Comprehensive Flexible Benefits including Health and Dental, Health Care Spending and Wellness Accounts, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, Life Insurance, Company Pension Plan, Group RRSP, Employee and Family Assistance, Stock Purchase Plan, Unlimited on-line learning through Sysco Interactive University, Sysco product discounts, Preferred vendor discounts, Free on-site parking, Employee appreciation events, (*benefits may vary based on location or bargaining unit)

column14: Location: Toronto, Canada, , L’Activité Mondiale Systèmes de Transport Terrestre fournit des solutions de signalisation ferroviaire pour les grandes lignes et les transports urbains, des systèmes intégrés de communication et de supervision, des solutions billettiques et les services associés., , Thales fournit des systèmes de commande de trains par télécommunications (CBTC) et des systèmes d’enclenchement destinés au secteur des transports en commun sur voie ferrée à l'échelle mondiale. Le centre de compétences pour la signalisation ferroviaire urbaine est situé au centre-ville de Toronto. Nous sommes le plus grand bureau situé au Canada et nous disposons d’un service pour chaque étape du cycle de vie du développement logiciel (SDLC). Cela comprend le logiciel, le matériel, la conception des systèmes, la vérification et la validation, les opérations, etc. Les équipes de services partagés dans les domaines des finances, des ressources humaines et des technologies de l’information sont également situées sur ce site. Notre espace de bureau est conçu pour fournir un milieu de travail sûr et durable qui correspond à la marque TRSS et qui favorise la collaboration. Le mobilier répond aux normes Greenguard, les appareils ménagers sont certifiés EnergyStar et les adhésifs et produits d'étanchéité répondent aux critères de faible émission. De plus, les portes coulissantes en verre laissent entrer la lumière dans les bureaux intérieurs qui offrent ainsi une vue sur l'extérieur. Venez vous joindre à la grande famille du Transport, ici à Toronto !, , Thales people architect solutions that support 85 million mainline and suburban passenger journeys, worldwide, every day. Our Rail Signalling and Communication systems are used on metro lines across major cities, and 72,000 kms of route, 52,000 trains per day in 16 countries are controlled by our Traffic Management Systems. Together We deployed the first-ever nationwide ticketing system which processes over 50 million ticketing transactions in 100 cities daily., , Thales provides world-leading Communications-Based Train Control (CBTC) and interlocking for mass rail transit applications globally. The Centre of Competence for Urban Rail Signalling is located right before you at mid-town Toronto. As the largest office in Canada, we house a department for every step of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)! This includes Software, Hardware, Systems Design, Verification & Validation, Operations, etc. The supporting corporate shared services teams in Finance, Human Resources and IT is also located at the office. Our office space was designed to provide a sustainable, healthy workplace that expresses TRSS’s brand while increasing collaboration. Features include Greenguard furniture, EnergyStar appliances, low-emitting adhesives, sealants, and sliding glass doors on internal offices provide daylight and views to the outside. Come join the big Transport family, here in Toronto!, , To support our development, we are looking for a Sales Operation Specialist who will report to the Vice-President Business Development & Sales, Urban Rail Signalling Business Line based in Toronto. You will contribute to the success of the Business Development & Sales team which is measured by achieving Order Intake budget at target margins., , Key Responsibilities:, , Work with Sales & BD team, Key Account Managers and Country Directors to maintain the CRM database and Sales forecasts by consolidation and/or regions, Support Business Development & Sales team regarding CRM tools and related business rules, Create/update tools to support sales operation processes, Prepare on a regular basis reports for management review which summarize OI status by regions and/or customers, Statistical analysis of qualitative & quantitative data, Keep abreast of general industry trends and competitors’ products and project awards while building/updating relevant databases based on relevant data extraction, Create an automatic information display based on regular database updates, Prepare performance & profitability measurements using financial statements and business and capture plan information, Perform market trend analysis and competitive assessment, Keep abreast of Thales’ technical developments and products, , Required Skills and Experience:, , Bachelor's degree in English, Science or Business and more than 2 years of experience in Sales Operations, Minimum of 2 years of experience in the transportation sector or equivalent sector, , Preferred Skills and Experience:, , Specific knowledge in Signaling market will be an asset, Excellent Skills in: Statistical analysis tools; Business Intelligence tools (Excel); Sales Database (CRM); Graphic tools (PowerPoint), Professional writing and communication skills, Spoken and written fluency in French may be an asset, , Chez Thales, nous proposons des CARRIÈRES passionnantes, pas de simples emplois. Fort de ses 80 000 collaborateurs dans 68 pays, Thales a mis en place une politique de mobilité permettant, chaque année, à des milliers d'employés de faire progresser leur carrière tant dans leur domaine d’expertise que dans de nouveaux domaines de compétences, cela aussi bien dans leur pays d’origine qu’à l'étranger. Ensemble, nous pensons qu’adopter une politique de flexibilité est une manière plus actuelle de travailler. C’est ici que commence votre parcours exceptionnel, postulez sans tarder!, , At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!, , Thales s’engage à promouvoir un lieu de travail diversifié et inclusif pour tous. Thales s’engage à fournir des accommodements à toute les étapes du processus de recrutement. Les candidats retenus pour une entrevue qui ont besoin d’accommodement sont priés d’en informer à la suite de l’invitation pour une entrevue. Nous travaillerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins. Toutes les informations relatives à l'accommodement fourni seront traitées de manière confidentielle et utilisées uniquement dans le but de fournir une expérience de candidat accessible., , Thales is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
column15:
The people we all rely on to make the world go round – they rely on Thales. Our customers come to us with big ambitions: to make life better, to keep us safer. 

Combining a unique diversity of expertise, talents and cultures, our architects design and deliver extraordinary high technology solutions. Solutions that make tomorrow possible, today. 

From the bottom of the oceans to the depth of space and cyberspace, we help our customers think smarter and act faster - mastering ever greater complexity and every decisive moment along the way. 

Follow Thales on http://www.thalesgroup.com
