column14: This role is a 1-year contract, , We maintain our excellent user experience across our mobile app, Flipp.com, and in coordination with hundreds of retailer partners including Walmart, Macy’s, IKEA, and Best Buy. Millions of people use the Flipp app every day to save time, spend less money, and make informed buying decisions. We’re on a mission to reach even more people and revolutionize the way they shop through mobile technology, data science, and delightful user experiences. Flipp is looking for an experienced Manager, Consumer Research to drive decision making across various verticals based on quantitative market research insights., , You are critical in pushing the boundaries here at Flipp. By understanding our users’ needs, we can drive better business and product decisions. Our Research and Design Teams focus on truly understanding our users’ problems and providing insights that are actionable and impactful for our internal clients. You will have full end-to-end ownership of your projects and will have significant autonomy in defining parameters and spotting opportunities for qualitative research initiatives., , , Your Impact, Lead and conduct quantitative consumer research from beginning to end, providing actionable recommendations on how to activate against key insights, Leverage knowledge from different sources and research methodologies to evaluate the best approach to respond to stakeholders’ business needs. Identify, build and integrate information to create insights, Synthesis and communication of both primary and secondary research findings into actionable insights according to the business objectives, Partners with the Enterprise vertical to develop research output in support of Flipp’s Thought Leadership initiative, Partners with the B2B Marketing and Sales Strategy teams to develop research output in support of Flipp's Thought Leadership initiative, Responsible for the management and on-going utilization of the Flipp proprietary consumer panel of Flipp users and non-users, Perform regular community health checks and panel refreshes to ensure high-quality engagements from members, Coach others on principles and practice of synthesis, models behavior and the insight building process, Collaborate with cross functional peers to develop and communicate a consumer driven business vision, , What you bring to the team, Bachelor degree in Mathematics, Business, Market Research and/or Psychology, 5+ years of relevant Market Research/Consumer Research/Consumer Insights experience, Expert knowledge across a broad range of market research techniques and analytical techniques, Experience managing direct reports, Experience with producing shopper insights and/or B2B market research, and driving actionable retail insights to aid in external conversations, Skilled in the application of research design and appropriate methodologies, Skilled in quantitative survey writing; Thorough understanding of survey flow, structure, intricacies, and ability to apply different survey techniques to different study types, Strong business acumen, with proven ability to apply research output to solve tough business problems, Demonstrated abilities to effectively manage external research vendors and other insights partners, Ability to synthesize data from multiple sources, tell a clear story, and influence key stakeholders, Proven ability to communicate and influence across teams, , Here’s how we work:, From working with top technologies to sending you to industry-leading conferences, we will make sure you have all that you need to expand your knowledge and grow your career. We have a trust-based culture where all team members are empowered to work in the way that’s best for them to thrive., Our culture is at the center of all that we do, and it has been recognized through numerous accolades over the past three years including: Best Workplaces in Canada, Deloitte 50 Best Managed, Best Workplaces in Canada for Women, Most Admired CEO and Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures., , Here's how to apply:, If you’re interested in working with us on the future of shopping, click the “Apply now” button to submit your application. While experience and skillsets are valuable, growth potential and attitudes are equally important. If you’re prepared to grow drastically with your team at a world-class learning organization, consider applying. We understand that the most creative solutions require diversity in thought and life experiences., We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
column15: Flipp is a retail technology company changing the way people shop. We work with the largest retailers in North America to help them succeed in the digital age. Our Flipp app connects these retailers with millions of users looking to plan and save money on their weekly shopping. We strive to be the best in class in all that we do — whether that’s helping our retailer partners transition to the digital age or giving team members the freedom and responsibility to make empowered and innovative decisions.

column14: About Trindent, , Trindent Consulting is a global management consulting firm that solves complex business problems and delivers operating efficiencies for the Energy, Healthcare, and Financial Services industries. The firm’s unique improvement approach yields between 500 – 1500% ROI within the first year. Established in 2008, Trindent Consulting has quickly garnered a reputation for a firm that Makes It Happen™. It was ranked as one of Canada’s Fastest-Growing Companies by Canadian Business and PROFIT 500 in 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019. Trindent was also named one of the Fastest-Growing Consulting Firms by Consulting Magazine in 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019., , Role Overview, , Trindent consultants review clients’ existing processes in order to identify improvement avenues that will improve our clients’ productivity. They collaborate in close knit teams of 2-6 consultants on projects that typically last from 3 to 9 months. Consultants spend the majority of their time working on client sites with anyone from frontline employees to C-Suite Executives, interacting and influencing key stakeholders and managing change. At Trindent we believe that small teams and client exposure creates a collaborative environment filled with learning opportunities., , Projects are scheduled to start in May and June. If immediate hiring needs arise, we will communicate the details with all successful applicants., , Travel Requirements, , This position may require you to travel 80% of the time. Travel to client sites in Canada and the United States will occur Sunday/Monday through Thursday/Friday. International travel to other countries may occur for up to three-week periods. Successful candidates must be eligible for a TN Visa to work in the US., , Responsibilities, Identify process barriers, constraints and variations such as errors, delays and rework and develop process changes that significantly impact and improve client productivity, Increase employee productivity by reducing workload fluctuations, developing tools for effective staffing in response to demand fluctuations, cross-training back office staff, eliminating manual processes, adapting responsibilities to maximize employee skill sets and driving employee accountability throughout key business processes, Critically assess client management systems, forecasting, scheduling, process control, tools, data, inputs, information quality, and reporting mechanisms, Conduct observations, identify areas for improvement to enhance managers’ ability to drive overall profitability of the area, and implement standard operating procedures, Perform complex financial modeling to express the impact of operational changes in real dollars, Adhere to standards to ensure sustainable and predictable results for the client, Evaluate dynamic and static measurement issues and concerns, Confer with project staff to outline work plans, assign responsibilities and work-stream scope, actively review status reports, and modify schedules or plans as necessary, Establish and maintain effective client engagement with client project team, Coach and mentor floor-level client management to adopt changes and actively manage areas, Participate in delivery of training programs and act as a mentor for Consultant-level staff, Design system tools, applications, and controls that enhance client managers’ ability to drive overall profitability of the area, Perform other responsibilities as required, Requirements, Bachelor’s degree in business, commerce, finance, engineering, health sciences or other relevant discipline is required. MBA or equivalent postgraduate degree is preferred, Consulting experience in an implementation-based management consulting firm is preferred, Experience consulting in the healthcare sector, financial services or oil & gas is an asset, Significant knowledge of processes-driven methodologies with a focus on continuous process improvement, Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work well with clients and colleagues, Knowledge of additional languages is considered an asset (i.e. French, Cantonese, Japanese, Mandarin, German, Korean, Spanish or Arabic). Please highlight your language skills in your resume, Advanced proficiency in and knowledge of MS Office Suite, Advanced data mining and data analysis skills in Excel are required, Clear understanding and following of business ethics and professionalism, Ability to work in ambiguous situations, remain flexible, and to successfully adapt to a variety of working environments, Superior numeracy, problem solving, and relationship building skills, Experience with the following process improvement tools is an asset:, , Conducting Process Analyses and Critiques, Lost Time Analysis, KPI Grids, Fishbone Analysis, Process Observations, Management Studies, Workload Analysis, Skills Analysis, Behavior Assessments, Responsibility Matrix, Sustainability Plan and Standard Operating Procedures, to name a few, Availability to travel 80% of the time, Trindent Consulting is committed to providing an accessible, respectful and inclusive environment for all employees and job applicants. We will provide reasonable accommodation if required. If you require any specific accommodation due to a disability or a medical need during the application process, please contact us.

column14: Company Overview, , Sysco is the global leader in selling, marketing and distributing food products to restaurants, healthcare and educational facilities, lodging establishments and other customers who prepare meals away from home. Its family of products also includes equipment and supplies for the foodservice and hospitality industries. With over 69,000 associates, the company operates more than 320 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 650,000 customer locations. For fiscal 2019 that ended June 29, 2019, the company generated sales of more than $60 billion., , Sysco, one of Canada’s Best Employers 2019, as listed by Forbes, is dedicated to our global corporate social responsibility goals and to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. Join our winning team., , For more information, visit www.sysco.ca or follow us @SyscoCanada at facebook.com/SyscoCanada; twitter.com/SyscoCanada or instagram.com/SyscoCanada, , For a full list of opportunities, visit www.sysco.ca/careers, , Role, , This role is responsible for creating custom reporting, analytics, and insights for all Field Sales & Marketing programs and initiatives. This includes Corporate and Regional marketing promotions and programs, GSM performance insights, Sysco Rewards, social media, sales technology, Business Resources, training and development, order channels, territory management, fiscal sales planning, and brand/sourcing sales growth initiatives., , Role Responsibilities, Reporting, analytics and profitability analysis for all Field Sales & Marketing programs and initiatives., Provide business insights to support data driven decision making to Corporate leadership and Regional sales leadership., Ability to present data and insights visually to be compelling and actionable for targeted stakeholders., Support the development of regular performance scorecards, period reporting, quarterly market review presentations and annual operating plans., Sysco Rewards Program administration such as analytics, reporting, new item process, IDS utilization, and maintenance. Supplier rewards enrollment and billing process., Supplier relations pertinent to invoicing and reconciliation including Central Billing., Database clean-up and maintenance., Support website and email marketing initiatives including digital delivery, content development, targeted marketing, testing, reconciliation/tracking and maintenance., Support and work with Regional field teams on insights, tracking and benchmarking., Optimizing existing reporting and processes., Is willing to work safely with minimal environmental impact and understands the importance of reporting all hazards, incidents, and environmental spills immediately to their Supervisor., Understands that they play an integral role in their own safety and that of their colleagues and is willing to speak out when hazards are present, Other Field Sales, Marketing and analysis/insights responsibilities as required., , Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements, , A minimum of three (3+) years job related experience, with experience in a marketing and/or analytical role preferred., Completion of post-secondary education in Data Science, Business Administration, Marketing, Commerce or related degree., Advanced proficiency using Excel, Word, and PowerPoint with the ability to learn rapidly as required., Proficiency in enterprise reporting tools – COGNOS and Tableau., Proficiency in digital analytical reporting tools including Google Analytics., Experience in website administration, data testing and optimization., Understanding of graphic packaging and web design., Understanding of Salesforce.com platform or similar CRM tools., Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills with an ability to build relationships at all levels and across functions., Ability to complete multiple work assignments under tight deadlines and agility to adapt priorities., Understanding of basic financial reporting and accounting procedures., , Internal candidates apply via the Career Centre on your HR Portal / ADP Workforce Now., , External candidates submit cover letter & resume via www.sysco.ca/careers, , Sysco’s Values: Integrity | Excellence | Teamwork | Inclusiveness | Responsibility, , Sysco’s Vision is to be our customers’ most valued and trusted business partner., , We offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds expectations., , Sysco is committed to Employment Equity. Accommodations during the recruitment process are available upon request for candidates with disabilities., , Here’s a sample of the many benefits Sysco associates enjoy:, , Comprehensive Flexible Benefits including Health and Dental, Health Care Spending and Wellness Accounts, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, Life Insurance, Company Pension Plan, Group RRSP, Employee and Family Assistance, Stock Purchase Plan, Unlimited on-line learning through Sysco Interactive University, Sysco product discounts, Preferred vendor discounts, Free on-site parking, Employee appreciation events, (*benefits may vary based on location or bargaining unit)

column14: Who We Are, , Hiring is hard. Two shortlists make it easier., , Hirefully is your professional-grade recruiting service, on-demand. That's two shortlists for better decision-making., , We recruit across all business functions and seniorities and thrive in the most competitive hiring market there is - technology., , Our process is designed to help you capitalize on untapped potential and find talent that enhances the rest of your team., , Fair fees. Gradual payments. On-demand. Hirefully., , Your Next Opportunity is Knocking, , Operations/Delivery - Team Lead, , Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (A.I.) platform that transforms vast volumes of data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable retailers and insurance providers to make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our platform can simulate potential outcomes that will directly affect our clients P&L. Daisy gives voice to the facts and help our clients prepare for a better future. Using our proprietary mathematical solutions, we provide retailers (or insurance providers) with a tool that helps them make the optimal decision in their operational strategies., , Role Description, , This new role provides the ideal candidate with an opportunity to lead a team and create a best in class operations/delivery function for a highly successful startup organization. Accountabilities include:, Lead the day-to-day (24/7) operations delivery activities for our retail and insurance clients to ensure SLA's are achieved. Leading the operations team in a highly efficient manner to ensure that resources, systems, tools, etc., are aligned to client deliverables, Implementing process automation for critical client deliverables and activities. You will be a key contributor in helping Daisy build a dev/ops environment, Ensuring that operational controls are in place for achieving client deliverables, Overseeing the delivery of client commitments, from the new client win stage, through to the ongoing day-to-day and ad-hoc delivery of client deliverables, Client communications from a delivery perspective, Review projects/deliverables for issues and risks to ensure efficient operations, Producing management reports on all delivery activities, , General Skills And Attitude, You possess at least a Bachelor’s degree. 7+ years operations delivery experience. 3+ years of which have been in a team lead or manager role, leading an operations team, You have a proven operations delivery background in a software as a service environment, where the solution is business intelligence, analytics or big data solutions to retail or insurance clients, You are willing to work very hard to achieve deadlines. Proven track record of delivering to SLA's, 5+ years experience working as a DBA, You have an interest in solving complex business problems. Your attention to detail is scary good!, Strong english written and verbal communication skills. You can connect with any level of clients., Strong MS Office skills, You Will, , , Have a strong work ethic, and enjoy working in a high pressure environment with continuous dead-lines for delivery, Have an ability to find creative client-focused solutions to complex problems, Enjoy working on small, high-performance teams. You possess outstanding team leadership abilities, Have a devotion to continuous service improvement
column15:
Canada’s talent pool is under siege. Recruiting has become an unfair fight where multi-nationals target our best minds and leave our entrepreneurial sector to scrap for the talent that remains. At the same time, our population is aging and there aren’t enough millennials to replace the retiring baby boomers. There’s never been a more challenging time to be recruiting.

Only a few Canadian recruiters possess the knowledge to advise and support the needs of early-stage companies. We are the talent partner for entrepreneurial companies that want relevant experience acquired from the right places – where the talent is scarce and the demand is fierce. We help Canada compete.

Hirefully is our fully-transparent service for employers that want a recruiter-on-demand, but not on staff. Our proprietary platform enables us to manage your job postings for and with your hiring team. As our Talent Advisors preview your applicants, the technology fosters collaboration, workflow and talent tracking. Learn more at www.hirefully.com

column15: Benevity, Inc., a certified B Corporation, is the global leader in corporate social responsibility and employee engagement software, including online giving, matching, volunteering and community investment. Many of the world’s most iconic brands rely on Benevity’s award-winning cloud solutions to power corporate “Goodness” programs that attract, retain and engage today’s diverse workforce by connecting people to the causes that matter to them. column14: Who we are, Trilogy Education Services, a 2U, Inc. brand, partners with the world's leading universities to help companies bridge the digital skills gap. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top institutions to power boot camps that prepare today's workers for tomorrow's jobs. , Our programs have been in existence since October 2015, and since that first class, we've launched an additional 300 classes with 50+ university partnerships. , , Job description, Are you an experienced financial analyst who is passionate about education and making an impact? Do you love empowering others to find life-changing opportunities? Then this may be the position for you!, , We believe learning a new technology, like FinTech, should be exciting and engaging — and that starts with the instructor. You'll notice that prior teaching experience isn't a prerequisite to being an Instructor. If you bring knowledge, strong communication, and a positive energy to the classroom, you're going to help students along their transformative path to a successful and rewarding career. We'll provide the training, lesson plans, and tools to support you on your journey of impacting lives in the classroom., , Check out the program details here: https://bootcamp.learn.utoronto.ca/fintech/, , Skills & Requirements, At least 4-5 years of FinTech experience (or equivalent), Bachelor's Degree, Background in:, Financial Fundamentals in Time-Series Analysis, Financial Ratios, and Financial Analysis, Python Programming in Python 3, Pandas, MAtplotlib, API Interactions, and JupyterLab, Financial Libraries and Tools like NumPy, SciPy, and Quantopian, Execution Algorithms, Monte Carlo Simulations, Risk-Data Aggregation, Forecasting, Financial Modeling, Modern Portfolio Theory, and Logistic Regression, Machine Learning using Algorithmic Trading, Random Forests, k-Nearest Neighbor (kNN), Support ZVector Machines (SVM), Linear Regression, and Scikit-learn, Blockchain and Cryptocurrency experience in Solidity, Ethereum, Consensus Algorithms, Transactions, Validation, Distributed Ledger, Bitcoin and Bitcoin Cash, and Mining, , What You Will Do:, Follow detailed lesson plans that include an active discussion environment and project-based learning , Provide empathy, support, and encouragement to students as they go through a life-changing experience, , Logistics:, 24-week program (this is a part-time commitment), Mon/Wed/Sat OR Tue/Thu/Sat schedule, Weekday Classes: 5:45 - 10pm (includes office hours and break), Saturday Classes: 9:15 - 2:30pm (includes office hours and break), , Other Perks:, Maintain your current career while teaching, Hone your own skills by teaching and mentoring others, Gain access to thousands of tech professionals around the globe that make up our instructional staff network, Experience the gratitude and fulfillment that comes along with teaching and giving back to the tech community
column15:
Trilogy Education Services, a 2U, Inc. brand, is a Workforce Accelerator that partners with the world's leading universities to help companies bridge the digital skills gap. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top institutions to power skills-based training programs that prepare today's workers for tomorrow's jobs. 

Our Values:

1. We put students first

We put students first because they deserve nothing less - and our university and employer partners expect nothing less. Every aspect of Trilogy's success depends on this.

2. We never stop improving

We believe that continuous improvement is the source of innovation. We lend an ear to both our fans and our critics in an effort to deliver better programs, better service, better communication, and better value.

3. We bring a "can do" attitude

We are a team of entrepreneurs who confront challenges head-on and figure things out. We value action, effort, commitment, and learning.

4. We succeed only as a team

Teamwork is critical to our success, and we place a tremendous value on how we work together in our immediate teams, between our business units, and across the entire company.

column14: Job Summary, , The Lead engineer is a critical part of our Engineering organization. As a member of an experienced engineering team in financial services, you will need to be able to cross boundaries easily and work collegially with highly effective individuals across the data services organization. You will be part of teams working at the forefront of trading applications technology, which include on-premise deployments as well as migration to AWS, big-data ingestion and analytics, distributed systems and algorithmic complexity., This role is expected to contribute to all parts of the software development and deployment life cycle, including design, development, documentation, testing and operations. You will be working towards a service-oriented architecture and launching data services/micro-services from the ground up, as well as building systems interacting with our trading cores., The following skill sets provide a good foundation for a quick ramp up to being productive in our environment, Algorithms, design patterns, data structures, Java, Linux and cloud-based development, Candidate Summary, , The Following Duties Include, But Are Not Limited To, Work on full-stack analytical applications, Responsible for developing highly performant and scalable components that are able to handle large amounts of financial data, Help develop distributed systems with concurrent access and usage patterns, Work closely with our product team and engineering teams to understand the needs of our clients, Qualification Summary, Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or another quantitative field. Ideally a Master's degree or above., 7+ years experience delivering highly scalable, fault tolerant, supportable and well architected solutions, Strong fundamental knowledge of computer science algorithms, data structures and design patterns, Significant cloud platform experience, preferably with AWS, Expert level Java or C++, Strong Unix and scripting skills, Expert knowledge of database systems; relational, NoSQL, Experience designing distributed systems at scale handling large data sets leveraging Apache Spark, Kafka, Kinesis, and Hadoop toolsets., Instinet is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Â© 2019 Instinet Incorporated and its subsidiaries. All rights reserved. INSTINET is a registered trademark in the United States and other countries throughout the world., Financial Disclosure, Legal & Regulatory, Privacy Policy, Terms & Conditions
column15:
When Instinet gave birth to electronic trading in 1969, we were a small tech-focused start-up with a simple point of view: technology can bring great efficiency to the financial markets. No one had coined the term “fintech” yet, but that’s exactly what we were. It’s been our mission to remain at the forefront of advancements that shape the financial markets ever since. 
 
Today, as a part of The Nomura Group, Instinet’s global agency model provides services that span the entire investment life cycle. Our goal is to help our institutional clients create, preserve, and capture alpha in a changing world.
 
We operate with a “client-first” approach—one that’s founded on robust and adaptive technology and has been enhanced by decades of experience fine-tuning our capabilities to a dynamic marketplace and the ever-evolving objectives of our clients.
 
Instinet offers the institutional investment community a suite of tailorable solutions, including a unique US equity research boutique, market insights and commentary, full-service trading desks, advanced algorithmic trading strategies, access to unique and specialized liquidity via our array of crossing pools, and a complement of award-winning workflow solutions. All engineered to help our clients efficiently manage their investment process, their way.

column14: We are looking for a strong Regulatory Affairs Consultant/Data Steward for a 6 month assignment with a strong chance to extend., , Duties, -       Regulatory Data Governance (DG) Data Steward is responsible for driving Data Governance Requests to completion for changes to Regulatory data, formats, standards and controlled vocabularies within Regulatory systems. Including full impact analysis of changes including impact on related systems and projects., -       Coordinates with Data Owners, System Owners, vendors, ITS, and Data Governance teams to investigate and analyze the request, impacts and related issues., -       Prepare analysis for Data Owners, & works together to resolve DG Request. Data Steward either implements the change directly, or coordinates with ITS to implement. Monitors regulatory & industry standards for changes., -       Enforces and Supports DG processes & works to ensure DG Requests are resolved, and the details are fully documented in the DG request tracker and other reference documentation., -       Works to ensure quality, compliance, and operational efficiency., -       Supports system integrations with Regulatory systems, including providing mapping of data and terminologies between systems and resolution of data related issues between systems., -       Governs the data business rules, objects and fields, formats, definitions, and dictionaries, picklists, controlled vocabularies., -       Promotes data literacy and understanding of our data, definitions and standards with Data Owners, Regulatory Affairs, and other Sanofi organizations., -       Governs and supports business data models, data flows and data lineage mapping for Sanofi's Regulatory data., -       Investigates industry and regulatory standards & requirements related to data formats and controlled vocabularies., -       Works to ensure Regulatory data formats & dictionaries stay current and compliant., -       With Business Data Owners defines & documents data model, data formats, and data related business rules., -       Maintains Regulatory Information Management (RIM) dictionaries in system. Documents DG recommendations and decisions for DG Requests, and maintains DG documentation., -       Maintains and prepares documentation of RIM dictionary content. This documentation used for traceability, audits, and for QC of the RIM database configuration., -       Authors, maintains and reviews Data Governance Job Aides describing detailed Data Steward activities.,   Skills, -       High attention to detail, -       Excellent documentation and communication skills are critical, -       Good presentation skills, -       Experience and understanding of the importance of data quality, -       Self-driven, conscientious and able to work within a collaborative work environment, -       Familiarity with ITS service/ticket systems, -       Background in Pharmaceutical Regulatory Affairs and Quality Operations,   Education/Experience, - Bachelor's Degree in Science (BSc.), Pharmaceutical Regulatory Affairs, - 4-6 years' experience in an analyst role/function, - Pharmaceutical Regulatory Affairs Experience with Pharmaceutical Regulatory Data and standards preferred

column14: The person in this role will be responsible for developing, managing and implementing the deployment of our client's advanced analytics solutions. This includes developing and executing the advanced analytics programs., , , Job Responsibilities, You will play a key role in building out our advanced analytics and machine learning capabilities within the organization, Work closely with various stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions through machine learning or other advanced analytics/predictive modelling techniques, Responsible for leading a team responsible for the building, training, scoring and monitoring of machine learning models, , Job Requirements, Experience in developing machine-learning algorithms, statistical and mathematical optimization models, and simulation and visualization tools, Strong understanding of regression modelling, time series analysis, cluster analysis, machine-learning concepts such as supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, random forest, neural nets, etc., Ability to identify predictive attributes of data sets and perform feature engineering to improve machine learning results, MS/PHD or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or related technical field, Minimum 2 years of management experience, Minimum of 6-8 years of directly related work experience in quantitative analysis, Experience with manipulating big data sets via SQL able to process, filter and present large quantities of data, Experience in one or more programming languages (e.g. Python, R, Scala, etc.), Experience with Databricks,Tableau and AutoML tools an asset
column15:
Prodigy Bank is a specialized recruitment company focusing on the intersection of technology, commerce and innovation. We help our Clients leverage talent and technology to accelerate growth; and our Candidates tap into a niche pipeline of opportunities.   Our team understands the unique requirements and skills of our clientele and helps them remove the noise in the marketplace.  
  As a global talent acquisition organization with offices in Toronto, London and New York, we are uniquely situated to provide our Candidates & Clients with unparalled access. With decades of technical & functional recruitment experience, we’ve built an unparalleled network and pride ourselves in leveraging our knowledge and expertise to deliver tangible value to those we serve.  
 Our core practices are: Technology 
 Capital Markets 
 Digital / eCommerce
 Revenue Generation
 
 At Prodigy Bank we’re also big believers in Karma! This is at the heart of our unwavering commitment to transparency, professionalism and ethical business practices. We strive above all to have a positive impact and footprint no matter where our journey takes us. 
 Our credo is to Empower, Enable and Engage our Clients, Candidates and Community.

column14: Job Description, Everest Clinical Research ("Everest") is a full-service contract research organization (CRO) providing a broad range of expertise-based clinical research services to worldwide pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device industries. We serve some of the best-known companies and work with many of the most advanced drugs, biologics, and medical devices in development today., Everest has been an independent CRO since 2004 with a strong foundation as a statistical and data management center of excellence. Building on this foundation, Everest has successfully developed and established itself as a full-service CRO. Everest’s headquarters are located in Markham (Greater Toronto Area), Ontario, Canada with additional sites in Little Falls (Greater New York City Area), New Jersey, USA, and Shanghai (Pudong Zhangjiang New District), China., Everest is known in the industry for its high quality deliverables, superior customer service, and flexibility in meeting clients’ needs. A dynamic organization with an entrepreneurial origin, Everest continues to experience exceptional growth and great success., Quality is our backbone, customer-focus is our tradition, flexibility is our strength...that’s us…that’s Everest., To drive continued success in this exciting clinical research field, we are seeking a committed, skilled, and customer-focused individual to join our winning team as Senior Clinical Database Designer for our Toronto/Markham, Ontario, Canada or Little Falls, New Jersey, USA, (on-site or remote) location., , Key Accountabilities:, Develop new features and functionality within the database design functional areas to increase the efficiency of database design at the study level, and to improve and enhance the company’s database design capabilities., Assist Clinical Data Management in planning, directing, and managing the clinical database design and maintenance process., Review the protocol and associated study reference materials to contribute to the development of the clinical database design project timeline. Maintain database design timelines and promote good project management practices., Follow up on regulatory requirements, industry trends, benchmarking, and best working practices in data management and database design by reading, participating in relevant training and/or relevant association activities., Design and review case report forms (CRFs/eCRFs) and setup electronic data capture (EDC) systems for clinical trials., Author and review the Data Validation Specifications for assigned projects., Develop and review User Acceptance Test (UAT) plans for clinical databases designed by other designers. Coordinate and oversee the UAT process for clinical databases., Design and review patient Case Report Forms and database schema. Test data capture/entry screens through UAT., Participate in EDC vendor’s technical learning and exchange meetings as well as other internal and external training meetings., Participate in trial Investigators Meetings and provide user training to CRAs on how to use EDC systems, and on Dataflow and Quality Control Processes., Contribute to the development and maintenance of the company’s database design procedural documents, work instructions, checklists and templates for all EDC systems., Provide input to all data management procedural documents., Plan, manage, control and perform data processing activities for assigned projects. These tasks are performed in a timely and accurate manner and in compliance with trial sponsors’ requirements., Review the Data Management Plan (DMP) for assigned projects., Review data, issue and resolve queries. Assist the Lead Data Manager, sponsor or Investigative Site with resolving queries., Assist in resolving medical coding discrepancies resulting from coding of medical history, adverse events, procedures and medicinal products., Cooperate with and assist the Quality Assurance Department with quality control audits on assigned databases. Validate and disseminate real-time study monitoring reports to sponsor and internal team members., Define and monitor clinical trial data flow and quality control processes in accordance to corporate SOPs, Good Working Practices, and unit guidelines., Accurately and efficiently validate electronically captured data. Write clear queries on missing data and data points failing pre-defined range checks and/or logical checks., Participate in and contributes to Clinical Data Management initiatives., Develop and test SAS codes for clinical trial database logical checks and study specific monitoring reports., Qualifications and Experience:, B.Sc. in Biological Sciences or Computer Science., Five years' related experience., Two to three years developing Inform and/or Medidata Rave (or similar) clinical data bases. Previous Clinical Data Management experience in both paper based and electronic data capture systems., Must communicate effectively, orally and in writing, with personnel on all professional and administrative levels., Proven leadership and interpersonal skills in complex team situations., Excellent presentation skills and the ability to build relationships with both internal and external clients., Must be well organized and able to work independently and manage multiple projects/tasks appropriately., Demonstrated ability to effectively organize and integrate the activities of information processing personnel.
column15:
Everest Clinical Research ("Everest") is a full-service contract research organization (CRO) providing a broad range of expertise-based clinical research services to worldwide pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device industries. We serve some of the best-known companies and work with many of the most advanced drugs, biologics, and medical devices in development today.

Everest has been an independent CRO since 2004 with a strong foundation as a statistical and data management center of excellence. Building on this foundation, Everest has successfully developed and established itself as a full-service CRO. Operating primarily in North America, with headquarters located in Markham (Greater Toronto Area), Ontario, Canada, with additional offices in Little Falls (Greater New York City Area), New Jersey, USA, and Shanghai, China. Everest is known in the industry for its high quality deliverables, superior customer service, and flexibility in meeting clients’ needs. A dynamic organization with an entrepreneurial origin, Everest continues to experience exceptional growth and great success.

Quality is our backbone, customer-focus is our tradition, flexibility is our strength...that’s us…that’s Everest!

column14: We are looking for a highly motivated, energetic and outgoing individual with excellent communication skills to join our team. Our successful candidate will: have a preference for an aggressive, entrepreneurial company where change happens on a daily basis; be challenged in your work and be recognized and rewarded when you go above and beyond (which is often!); most importantly, the candidate will want to be in a place that’s full of people like you- A players who are fiercely intelligent, share a passion for their work, and know how to have fun!, , Why work with us?, We’re a fun-loving, passionate, and highly collaborative team, We believe in moving quickly, failing fast, and adapting to change, We’re committed to achieving technical excellence in everything we do, , Why we’d want to work with you?, You have an undying passion for building world-class software, You’re positive thinking and find opportunities instead of problems, You have superb technical chops. But, you’re always striving to improve, You believe software should be just as beautiful on the inside as it is on the outside, You are willing to hustle, get in the weeds and will not rest until the job is done, , What would a typical day look like, you ask? Something like this:, , Work with product and design teams to determine research needs, identify the most appropriate methods, create protocols and plans, generate recruitment screeners, moderate sessions, analyze results, compile reports, and present findings, Identify meaningful insights that fuel improvements to our products, Participate in project kickoffs, design critiques and ideation sessions. Use these and other opportunities to share findings and insights from research and key feedback from users, Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative and quantitative methods, Incorporate a "continuous discovery" approach to informing and guiding product design and development, Work cross-functionally with design, product management, data science, content strategy, engineering and marketing, Act as a thought leader in research, Advocate for the people who use our products, Contribute to the conversation about best practices around how to build the best software for our users, Articulating research questions and priorities with multiple teams using a range of research methods to answer those questions, , Do you have what it takes? We will be responding to applicants that have:, , 5+ years conducting research in a SaaS product environment, A deep understanding of the end-to-end iterative UX product design process, Experience dealing with high levels of organizational complexity, working directly with product managers, designers, and engineers, taking into account business and technical constraints when planning research and making recommendations, Clear and compelling presentation skills with proven ability to integrate insights into product design and a user-centered design practice, A passion for user research, the user, and a truly collaborative spirit, Ability to self-manage, self-motivate and deal with large amounts of complexity and ambiguity, , Achievers is one of North America’s leading corporate rewards & recognition providers. Named one of the Best Small & Medium Employers, Most Democratic Workplaces, Next Generation Employer of Choice and Top 10 places where Employees Thrive, we offer an outstanding corporate culture, competitive benefits, a generous vacation policy, and many opportunities for personal and professional growth., , This is your chance to be part of an exceptional team of people to contribute to an environment where innovation and initiative are encouraged and rewarded. If you love a challenge, share our “work hard/play hard” mentality, thrive on change and continuously strive for excellence in all that you do, apply for a position with us today., , Achievers is committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner, and will do so by preventing and removing barriers to accessibility and meeting accessibility requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.
column15:
Blackhawk Network delivers branded payment solutions to retailers, corporations and agency partners to increase reach, loyalty and revenue.

At Blackhawk Network, we look for people who want to shape the future of the global branded payments industry. Collaborating with our partners, we deliver the innovative solutions required to meet our partners’ business objectives — extending commerce opportunities, introducing innovative incentives and creating meaningful employee engagement. 

You could be part of this entrepreneurial culture, while experiencing the stability and benefits of a robust, global corporation. Visit our website to view all of our current job openings: http://bit.ly/2s0Zese. For customer service inquiries, please contact us at bh.customerservice@bhnetwork.com.

Founded in 2001, Blackhawk Network is headquartered in Pleasanton, California with more than 1,000 employees, and offers products and services in the United States as well as 26 other countries. For more information please visit www.blackhawknetwork.com.

column14: We are expanding our team — please join us as a Security Analyst. This position can be work from home and can be located anywhere within Canada., , We are looking for a Security Analyst to join Wysdom.AI – a fast-growing Conversational AI company helping businesses offer their customers natural language AI solutions that deliver automated customer service and support over chat, through smart devices, search, or on the phone., , Wysdom is the world’s only Conversational AI that gets optimized every day, ensuring customers are getting the high-quality experience they expect. And it’s the only comprehensive conversational AI service around; with cutting-edge AI management tools, a massive library of AI training assets, and an AI optimization practice to ensure the customer’s solution performs at its best. Established in 2012, we’re trusted by leading brands and offer our solution to clients in North America, Latin America, and Europe., , We do all the work for enterprises as their business evolves, from set-up to optimization. Our customer’s only job is to tell us what matters to their customers and what matters to them. We’ll take it from there, while providing the ongoing insights on how Wysdom is shaping the experience of the enterprise’s customers., , The Wysdom platform is built on a state-of-the-art NLP infrastructure, complemented with the tools, data and people to ensure successful operation of the suite of Wysdom products., , What does the Wysdom Security Analyst do?, , Our team oversees the security and compliance of the internal systems, software, and technical tools used to build the Wysdom.AI solution. We ensure our 50+ employees have access to the resources and information they need to do their job while maintaining confidentiality, integrity, and availability., , As a Security Analyst, you will work with the Sr. Director of IT, Infrastructure, and Security to help build, secure, deploy and maintain internal policies and procedures, systems, and tools related to our security and privacy., , But what will I be doing?, , Typical Day-to-day Responsibilities Include, Working on our SOC 2 Compliance, including integration with compliance management tools, Working with our Auditors to ensure evidence is collected in a timely and accurate manner, Proactively identifying any issues or gaps for remediation, Documenting, updating, and enforcing Security and Privacy Policies and Procedures, Assisting in development of company-wide best practices for IT security, Managing internal and external vulnerability and penetration testing and remediation, Overseeing Risk Management and Mitigation, Vendor Compliance, and Security Audit Questionnaires, Testing and securing computers and networks, Staying up to date on information technology trends and security standards, , About You, University Degree or equivalent work experience, Analytical and methodical mindset and a love of policies and procedures, Understanding of information security and related fields, Ability to translate complex security requirements into actionable processes and procedures, Experience with or knowledge of security (SCF / CIS / NIST), compliance (SOC 2 / ISO) and privacy (COPPA / GDPR) Frameworks, Experience with/ awareness of external audits (SOC 2 is ideal, ISO or other a benefit), Security certifications (CEH / CSSP / CISSP) or related real-world experience ideal, A strong grasp of IT, systems security, cloud security, and systems automation, Understanding of firewalls, proxies, SIEM, antivirus, and IDPS concepts, Ability to identify and mitigate risks and vulnerabilities, Understanding of device, patch, and security management, Understanding of the business impacts of security, Willingness to take initiative, and to work effectively with employees at all levels in the company, Very high personal standards, in terms of completing work accurately and on time, Strong communications skills, with a solid grasp of English writing, Ability to thrive in a dynamic and often demanding environment, A Commitment to high ethical standards, with confidentiality and personal judgement key requirements, , About Wysdom.AI, , Wysdom.AI is a venture-funded start-up and is led by an experienced team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products. We offer a terrific work environment in all our offices (including Friday lunches and in-office massage), full company-paid benefits from your first day, and a stock option program, to ensure you participate in the growth we see ahead. Head here to read more about what it’s like to work at Wysdom., , Powered by JazzHR
column15: Wysdom.AI is the easiest way for businesses around the world to offer conversational AI that actually works. Built on nearly a decade of research and patented technology innovation, Wysdom transforms the way conversational AI learns from customers and gets better every day. We offer the only comprehensive conversational AI service, with cutting-edge AI management tools, tech, a massive library of AI training data, and an AI training practice to ensure your solution performs well. Established in 2012, we are trusted by leading brands and have enterprise deployments in North America, Latin America, and Europe. Get in touch at wysdom.ai.

column14: NorthBay Solutions is recognized as a premier provider of Big Data Solutions & Services. We are an AWS advanced consulting partner certified in big data, public sector, mobile, machine learning, DevOps and education competencies. We design big data, mobile & web solutions for premier brands and working with some of the most progressive companies in the world and creating profoundly impactful solutions., , NorthBay is seeking technically savvy hands-on Big Data Solutions Architects to implement solutions for our customers working with our offshore engineering team. In this role, you will collaborate with NorthBay customers, some working onsite, understand requirements and needs, translate into specifications to develop solutions, drive work with offshore engineering teams, and deliver solutions and results to the customer. This includes assessing customer needs, re-engineering business intelligence processes, designing and developing data models, and sharing your expertise throughout the deployment process., , Responsibilities, Interface with client project sponsors to gather, assess and interpret client needs and requirements, Develop a data model and Data Lake design around stated use cases to capture client's KPIs and data transformations, Identify the relevant AWS services -- especially on Amazon EMR, Redshift, Athena, Glue, Lambda, etc and an architecture that can support client workloads/use-cases; evaluate pros/cons among the identified options before arriving at a recommended solution optimal for the client's needs., Be a hands-on SA… architect, code and facilitate full-scale development., Be able to explain to the client the tradeoffs among the various AWS options, and why the recommended solution(s) and architecture was chosen as an optimal one for the client's needs., Work closely with the client and broader NorthBay Delivery team to implement in Agile fashion the architecture and chosen AWS services using AWS Best Practices and principles from the AWS Well-Architected Framework, Assess, document and translate goals, objectives, problem statements, etc. to our offshore team and onshore management, Advising on database performance, altering the ETL process, providing SQL transformations, discussing API integration, and deriving business and technical KPIsHelp transition the implemented solution into the hands of the client, including providing documentation the client can use to operate and maintain the solution., Help NorthBay Solutions with its Continuous Improvement processes to learn from each customer project, including doing project retrospectives and writing up "Lessons Learned"., Able to travel up to 40%, Qualifications (Must Haves:), Strong Design / Development Experience on Amazon EMR or AWS GLUE, preferably with Spark (PySpark or Scala), Strong troubleshooting / admin experience with EMR or AWS GLUE - specific to infrastructure (CloudFormation) code, deployment via AWS CLI, and bootstrap actions., Ability to implement transient infrastructure (e.g. transient EMR clusters) that leverages decoupled storage (S3) and compute. Implement these using reproducible automated mechanisms like AWS CLI scripts, CloudFormation templates, and custom code leveraging AWS SDKs., Strong experience in data lake design patterns factoring in key features like ACID transactions,updates and deletes,Data Versioning,Schema Evolution,Schema Enforcement, Audit History, Metadata handling., Strong experience on one or more MPP Data Warehouse/Database Platforms preferably AWS RedShift, PostgreSQL, Teradata,Oracle, Aurora postgres/mysql or similar., ossess in-depth working knowledge and hands-on development experience in building Distributed Big Data Solutions including ingestion, caching, processing, consumption, logging & monitoring, Strong Development Experience on at least one or more event-driven streaming platforms preferably Kinesis, Firehose, Kafka, Spark Streaming, or Apache Flink, Strong Data Orchestration experience using one or more of these tools: AWS Step Functions, Lambda, AWS Data Pipeline, AWS Glue orchestration, Apache Airflow, Luigi or related, Strong understanding and experience with Cloud Storage infrastructure, and operationalizing AWS-based storage services & solutions preferably S3 or related, Strong technical communication skills and ability to engage a variety of business and technical audiences explaining features, metrics of Big Data technologies based on experience with previous solutions, Strong Understanding of at least one or more Cluster Managers (YARN, Hive, Kubernetes, Pig, etc), Qualifications (Nice to Haves:), Strong Data Cataloging experience preferably using AWS Glue or Other, Strong Development Experience on at least one NoSQL OR Document databases, Experience on at least one or More Ingestion Integration tools Like Apache NIFI or Streamset or related, Strong Development Experience on at least one Caching Tool like Amazon Elasticache (with Redis or Memcached) or Lucene, Strong Understanding and experience in Big Data Audit Logging and Monitoring solutions like AWS CloudTrail and CloudWatch., Additional Qualifications, 5+ years of AWS Solutions implementation, professional services experience, prefer Data Analytics space.A passion for exploring data and extracting valuable insights., Proven analytical, problem solving, and troubleshooting expertise., Proficiency in SQL, preferably across a number of dialects (we commonly write MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift, SQL Server, and Oracle)., Exposure to developer tools/workflow (e.g., git/github, *nix, SSH)Experience optimizing database/query performance., Experience with AWS ecosystem (EC2, S3, RDS, Redshift)., Experience with business intelligence tools with a physical model (e.g., MicroStrategy, Business Objects, Cognos)., Experience with data warehousing., Exposure to NoSQL-based, SQL-like technologies (e.g., Hive, Pig, Spark SQL/Shark, Impala, BigQuery,Mongo), Excellent verbal and written communication skills, Education And Experience, Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Equivalent, Minimum five years of Big Data Engineering on AWS experience, Desired Certifications, AWS Solution Architect, AWS Big data Specialty, Or any Data Centric Certifications
column15:
We work with AWS professionals worldwide to find the perfect employer to match their skills and career goals, with teams specializing in Big Data, Business Intelligence, DevOps, IaaS/PaaS and security. 

We are part of the award-winning Frank Recruitment Group that has worked with over 30,000 businesses globally, and have a proven track record servicing the AWS permanent and contract recruitment market.

At Jefferson Frank, our mission is simple: we want happy customers. No matter what kind of role you’re looking for, our goal is to deliver an unrivalled customer experience. Work with us and you’ll get the personalized experience you deserve.

We’re dedicated to AWS recruitment—it’s all we do. That means we’re able to give you unique insights on the marketplace and tailored advice throughout the hiring process—but that’s not all. We believe in a personalized approach for every AWS professional we work with, offering support from interviews to relocation and more. 

We don’t just find jobs in AWS—we help build careers.

Now on AWS Marketplace.

column14: You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world., , Role Summary, , Job Description:, , This strategic role is responsible for leading the enterprise date architecture initiatives and programs that support business priorities and technical roadmap. This includes providing enterprise data architecture solutions and technical direction to Data teams in order to support and enhance ML/ AI and data analytics capabilities., , The position can be located at the Sun Life office in Downtown Toronto, North York or Waterloo, depending on where a suitable candidate is found., , What will you Do?, , Reporting to the VP, Enterprise Architecture, the Head of Enterprise Data Architecture is responsible for the overall architecture, patterns, and reference architecture for the Data, Advanced Analytics and reporting which cover all aspects of data management at Sun Life., , The role works very closely with the team of Enterprise Architects (across domains and platforms) and Data and Analytics Team who interact closely with the business in understanding business needs and architecting solution options. The role also interacts very closely with Data organizations across enterprise, where a team of individuals focus on the delivery of client centric business solutions., , The responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:, Own, Lead and Manage the overall Enterprise Data Architecture Strategy, both cloud and on premise, and Roadmap for i) Information Management ii) Advanced Analytics (Machine Intelligence) and Business Intelligence, and iii) Reporting domain at Sun Life. This includes the active management of understanding new and emerging technologies within the domains, and the active sunsetting of obsolete products., Support Data and Analytics center in translating strategic requirements into usable enterprise data architectures, which may include an enterprise data model., Develop a metamodel management and repository strategy to manage all enterprise data architecture artifacts., Identify data workload drivers for the selection between cloud and on premise, based on factors such as latency, consumption patterns and others for systems of record, engagement and insight., Work closely with the Business and technology partners to ensure effective implementation of new technologies that support Information Management, Artificial Intelligence and Analytics, Develop, communicate, and support the implementation of corporate policies, standards, and procedures that provide effective architecture, governance and management of Sun Life’s information/data assets., Ensure projects are following best practice data architectures for delivery by the Data Engineering team., Ensure the enterprise information architecture alignment to the overall enterprise architecture strategies., Monitor and provide product recommendations on new information management, business intelligence, and data analytics advances within the technology industry as well as the Financial Services industry., Partner with business, and analytics team to design, develop and demonstrate the value of integrating data across multiple subject areas using cloud based solutions, Develop and maintain effective and efficient information management, business intelligence, and data analytics ownership awareness and training programs., Monitor regulatory guidelines (such as consumer privacy issues) and compliance guidelines (such as data retention and audit requirements) to determine impact on enterprise information management, business intelligence, and data analytics., Service as a liaison between various groups dealing with information management, business intelligence, and data analytics management matters (e.g. Legal, Internal Audit, External Audit, Risk Management)., Keep the CIO and Senior ES Management appraised of trends, best practices and issues relating to information management, business intelligence, and data analytics., What will be needed to succeed?, Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related area., 15+ years experience in a large IT organization, within a minimum of 10 years in Information Management, Business Intelligence, and Data Analytics., 10+ years experience architecting and implementing solutions involving information management, business intelligence, and data analytics in a large financial organization, or a large regulatory organization, Exposure to modern data architecture and knowledge of modern databases (RDBMS, No SQL, Graph, etc…), Strong ability to balance a wide variety of trade-offs and drivers across the multiple skill areas contributing to, and impacting by, data architecture decisioning., Knowledge in the architecture and design of information management architectures, business intelligence frameworks, and data analytics patterns that enable a well integrated, transactional, collaborative, and agile suite of systems., Knowledge of cloud services, both Azure and Amazon, including S3, Redshift, Sagemaker, Cloud formation and the various data and database formats available in cloud solutions such as Athena., Modeling experience within a large enterprise, within information management, business intelligence, and data analytics., Understanding of common patterns, frameworks, and reference architectures for information management, business intelligence, and data analytics., Deep understanding of the Financial Services is preferred, Competencies, Ability to manage through influence in a complex and evolving environment to meet challenging time lines and organizational goals., Ability to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence., Demonstrated problem solving, communication and organizational skills, a positive attitude, and the proven ability to negotiate and influence others to obtain desired results. Strong professional consulting skills., Ability to speak in business terms, as well as the ability to effectively communicate both internally and externally., Mature, confident, and performance-oriented., Capable of developing strong relationships with all levels of management., An excellent communicator, team player and someone who is intellectually honest., Ability to adapt thinking and response to the geographic differences across our global operations., What's in it for you?, Being part of our journey in developing the next greatest digital experience, Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family, Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security, A ‘dress for the day’ dress code, where you dictate how you dress based on your day, The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results., , Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds., , Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com ., , We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted., , Salary Range, , 102,500/102 500 - 169,200/169 200, , Job Category, , IT - Application Development, , Posting End Date, , 21/06/2020

We provide a wide range of insurance and investment products and services in key markets around the world including Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, Hong Kong, the Philippines and Indonesia. At Sun Life, we have more than 34,000 employees and 112,900 advisors worldwide.

column14: Buchanan, Business Analyst, , Contract, , Oakville, , Our client is launching an enterprise wide intelligence database project and requires a senior Business Analyst to be part of the project team., , Job Profile, The Business Analyst will be required to understand the Project goals and the key objectives of the Project., Experience in collecting business requirements and developing business cases for a green field application implementation within IT (preferably integrating various Databases) that have a significant impact on an enterprise level., Requires working with the Project Specialist or otherwise in coordinating meeting with the core team to ensure all required stakeholder requirements are listed and submitted in a professional report., Using sing an existing EPMO business case template and minute's templates to author a business case for the project., Outlining a detailed plan of how they will be undertaking all the tasks within the first week of engagement., The following will be required as per their responsibilities to ensure that the business case has all the required deliverables:, A study of the current state of the organization for the provided intelligence database- a collection of all the business requirements as per the problem statement and associated impacts to the business processes., Understanding and formulating the Problem Statement in alignment with the Organization's Strategic Plan., Developing various solution options by engaging all the key stakeholders & the core team to gather facts, vendor data, academic research (if applicable), executing environmental scans as and when needed (by following up with the peer organizations or collecting the data as provided by the team members) and anything else as is necessary to meet the business needs., Evaluating each solution in depth through associated advantages and disadvantages of each developed solution., Creating a budgetary estimate for each of the solutions developed through sufficient research and factual data., Providing sound judgement on rating the solutions and working with the team lead and Project Specialist to form recommendations on the business case., Providing a Work Plan or Work Break Down structure which aligns with the recommended solution., Listing all assumptions and risks evaluated during the process of business analysis., , Qualifications, More than 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst is the Information Technology space;, Has experience in enterprise wide projects;, Preferred experience in being engaged with intelligence data base projects;, Excellent facilitation and customer engagement skills;, Graduate of a university degree

column14: Come and join a successful, relational and passionate company dedicated to individual growth, ethical treatment, and a healthy work/life balance. Our core values contribute to increased productivity, employee retention and strong internal team support. This translates to the enhanced ability to delivery specialized solutions to our diverse customer base. Work Smarter, work safer, work Sandalwood!, , The PTC ThingWorx Integrator will join a growing team of Engineering and Health & Safety professionals helping our customers reduce their work-related risk to quality, productivity and employee health. The right candidate will apply the principles of IIoT development and integration services for our customers. The main focus will be on systems integration solutions utilizing the PTC ThingWorx platform at customer locations around the globe., , Requirements, Two years of practical PTC ThingWorx experience including custom development and integration services, Five years of IIoT project experience in manufacturing environments., Two years of web-based development using javascript., Two years of Java programming experience, Work onsite with customers and team members to develop and document project requirements, Provide custom development and systems integration services to meet customers functionality requirements, Configure data collections to plant floor devices, Provide data validation and system testing support, User training as required, Knowledge of Rockwell Factory Talk Historian or OSI Pi, , , Willingness to travel and support projects in the United States and elsewhere, , Education Required, , B.S. Information Systems, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent work experience in the requested field, , Successful candidates will have the following attributes, Experience in automotive production processes, and protocols, Ability to establish priorities, work both independently and in team settings, A professional manner with excellent organizational and communication skills, , , Benefits, Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision), Retirement Plan (RRSP), Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D), Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays), Short-Term & Long-Term Disability, Training & Development
column15: Sandalwood is an engineering and ergonomics consulting firm. Sandalwood designs and executes strategic programs for manufacturers which reduce their work-related risks to quality, productivity and employee health. By providing knowledge, research, technology and resources, Sandalwood supports its clients at the executive level as well as on the factory floor.

column14: Position Profile:, The HR Solution Specialist is responsible for supporting and maintaining human resource information systems (HRIS) for their organization. They are in charge of providing advisory services, technical guidance and training to internal customers on the operation and maintenance of SuccessFactors Employee Central. One of their main responsibilities includes staying up to date with current system releases, developing and implementing strategies to address problem areas with the HR solution including implementing continuous improvement strategies. They must work well in a team setting to meet objectives in a timely manner; however, they also need to be able to perform effectively with minimal supervision., , Responsibilities of the HR Solution Specialist include:, System Support and HRIS Service Desk, , Management and triage of issue defects related to HRIS and ensure day-to-day issues are addressed/resolved., Assisting SMEs in developing system documentation for their specific SuccessFactors modules, provide proper training aids that meet change management governance., Troubleshooting bugs and working with vendors to resolve issues., Collaborating with HR customers and other business functions to design processes that will improve overall effectiveness and efficiency., , Project Management, Optimization and HR Business Process Owner, Responsible for developing 1-2-year HRIS strategy and roadmap for existing or net new systems with a holistic view of the business., Creating and maintaining a business process for users to submit enhancement suggestions related to HRIS., Responsible for ensuring project plans and work demands of the team are realistic and deadlines are met including working with Project Management Office., Maintain positive relationships with appropriate HR, IT, Finance, Mgmt. / Admins and third-party vendors to determine enhanced offerings for current and future system functionality., Responsible for creating and maintaining system architecture maps and system documentation., , Data Quality, Training and Security, Evaluating data quality issues and determining methods to improve system accuracy., Ensure HR related data follows all applicable policies, laws, General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)., Creating and maintaining training aids., Facilitate training for new HR end-users and refreshers sessions., Evaluating data quality and preventative strategies to maintain accurate data.,  Skills/Qualifications of the HR Solution Specialist include:, Minimum 1 year of SuccessFactors Employee Central experience or 5 years’ experience with a similar solution., Excellent written and presentation skills., Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Human Resources Management, or related discipline required., Experience with SAP HR or Payroll is preferred., Experience with SuccessFactors Talent Management is preferred., Advanced skills in Excel required., Ability to provide direction to HRIS analyst & administrators and influence stakeholders to ensure that solutions are effective and in keeping with the overall HRIS strategy., Excellent People Management skills ‐ Coach, develop, and motivate employees on the HRIS team. Apply appropriate leadership styles based on the project, skills and experience of team members., Strong analytical skills and attention to detail required., Strong customer service focus with demonstrated skills in supporting users to assist in addressing issues and concerns., Demonstrated effective written and verbal communication skills., Excellent organizational skills and detail orientation, ability to prioritize and meet deadlines., Demonstrated ability to learn and use a variety of software applications such as HRIS and payroll systems, Microsoft Office., Must be able to work independently or in a team environment with rapidly changing priorities and demands.,  Additional Role Information: , We are also highly active and committed to creating an environment which is accessible to all of our customers, employees and applicants. Reasonable accommodations in the hiring process will be provided to people with disabilities upon request., , Flynn Group of Companies is an affiliated contractor with the Helmets to Hardhats Program., For more information about starting your career with Flynn please visit www.flynncompanies.com
column15:
The Flynn Group of Companies is North America's leading building envelope trade contractor. Since 1978 we have been providing quality contracting services in the institutional, commercial, and industrial construction marketplace. 

The Flynn Group of Companies employs in excess of 5000 people in 35 office locations and is positioned in five distinct, but related, business sectors:

- Roofing Systems
- Glazing & Curtain Walls 
- Architectural Metals 
- Roofing Service 
- Environmental Solutions

ATTENTION BUSINESS OWNERS:

Flynn is currently looking to grow. Whether you are concerned about succession planning or in expansion mode, we can help you take your business and team to the next level. We are looking to merge with companies whose values are aligned and who have like-minded business owners. With more than 40 years of experience, Flynn has grown by acquisition and subsequent organic growth resulting in profitable, long-term equity opportunities for its key leaders. 

If you are interested and your company's annual sales are in excess of 5 million dollars of low-slope roofing, please email business.opportunities@flynncompanies.com
