column14: Elastic is a search company that powers enterprise search, observability, and security solutions built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Barclays, Cisco, eBay, Fairfax, ING, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe. Learn more at elastic.co, , About The Role, , We are looking for an experienced product leader to be responsible for the growth and go-to-market aspects of Elastic Cloud, Elastic’s rapidly growing hosted service., , We are looking for a person who has helped define the vision and made critical decisions in the evolution of a technology focused SaaS product and has experience in leading a fast growing product offering and a team of Product Managers who are distributed around the world., , What You Will Be Doing, Lead, develop and grow a team of highly skilled Product Managers., Work closely with the Elastic Cloud Engineering Team and Tech leads to define and maintain a shared vision for the future of Elastic Cloud., Drive growth of the service by continuously iterating and improving the user on-boarding and ongoing product experience., Work with upstream product and engineering teams at Elastic to ensure awareness and alignment of the priority and timing of critical features and changes, and their applicability to the Elastic Cloud platform., Collaborate with the Sales & Marketing teams on go-to-market, messaging, competitive analysis and enablement., Collaborate with the Elastic community team on promotional activities for Elastic users across the world., Gather market competitive and trend data, customer and community feedback and usage information to develop product insights, , What You Being Along, You hold a BS degree in Computer Science or bring equivalent technical experience, You bring a minimum of 10 years in Product Management, of which at least 5 years have been spent leading product teams and managing technology focused SaaS products, Excellent written and spoken communications skills, Solid understanding and familiarity with cloud technologies (such as AWS, Azure, and GCP) and developer-focused products, Solid understand of SaaS business models and sales motions, Curiosity and an open mind, Ego-free attitude — we are here for the success of the team and the company, Empathy, transparency, and a good sense of humour, , Experience/interest In Some Of These Areas Would Be Nice, Direct experience with the Elastic Stack, or experience with one or more of the common use-cases for the Elastic Stack, such as application search, logging, metrics, APM, business analytics, security analytics, GIS, etc., Comfort working in a very cross-functional role, with a highly distributed, global team, Open source software and/or commercial open source companies, Experience with products offered both via SaaS and self-managed, Good sense of user experience and design, , #, , Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People, , As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do., , We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do., Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary, Health coverage for you and your family in many locations, Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles, Generous number of vacation days each year, Double your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent), Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love, Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave, , Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.
column15: Elastic (NYSE: ESTC) is a search company. As the creators of the Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash), Elastic builds self-managed and SaaS offerings that make data usable in real time and at scale for use cases like application search, site search, enterprise search, logging, APM, metrics, security, business analytics, and many more. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians working in countries around the world. Learn more at elastic.co.

column14: Business Development Representative, , Askuity is a Toronto-based retail analytics software company operating as an innovative new division within The Home Depot (THD). Askuity’s mission is to enable suppliers and merchants at The Home Depot to make profitable, data-driven decisions and drive real-time execution., , The Business Development Analyst is a sales-based role within Askuity to roll out Home Depot’s analytics program to its suppliers in the US and Canada. Successful candidates will be able to showcase and sell the benefits of the Askuity platform and its associated analytics tools to all suppliers., , Key Success Factors In This Role Include, Working closely with Home Depot’s internal merchandising teams, Gain a clear understanding of each department’s business objectives, Grow the number of registered suppliers enrolled in Home Depot’s analytics initiatives, The main objective of the role is sell the program and hit your targets for each group of suppliers., , Position Responsibilities, Manage registration of new suppliers to Home Depot’s new analytics initiatives, Contact suppliers and merchants to establish rapport and arrange meetings with both parties, Researching organizations, departments to find specific value propositions for those departments, Act as the main point of contact for escalations during registration to both merchants and suppliers, Demonstrate the Askuity platform and its associated analytics tools to supplier partners at all levels, Liaise with internal Askuity teams (Supplier Execution, Development, Support, Product & Community Enablement) to ensure optimal supplier experience, Become a subject matter expert for assigned department groups and their value propositions, , Desired Skills And Experience, 2+ years of sales and/or customer service experience in B2B space, Excellent computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Salesforce, Critical thinking, resourcefulness, attention to detail, and problem-solving, Excellent communication skills; able to communicate effectively with all levels at an organization, Retail industry experience is an asset, Customer centric mindset, Post secondary education required, , What We Offer, Competitive compensation package, including excellent health benefits and training opportunities, A start-up setting with the stable backing of The Home Depot, Spacious, collaborative workspace in the heart of Toronto tech district, Team lunches, regular social gatherings, and an impressive lineup of snacks, Ping pong and video games (and some seriously competitive gamers), Indoor bike parking, Dog-friendly office

column14: Advertisement: Open Systems Technologies is a national provider of smart staffing solutions, providing contract staffing, permanent placements and executive searches in the following skill areas: Technology, Finance, Accounting, Healthcare, and Operations., , At Open Systems Technologies, our mission is to connect clients with the top talent in their industries. Since emerging as a leading supplier of technical engineers to the financial services sector on Wall Street in 1990, we have grown in size and in revenue to become one of the largest privately-owned staffing firms in the U.S and Toronto, ON, Canada. Through hard work and ingenuity, we have been able to take our passion for technology and turn it into a thriving business. We have experienced organic growth over the past several years and currently employ over 1,500 consultants in 16 US states including Toronto/ON, Montreal/QC and international markets., , Position Summary, As a Senior Technical Recruiter, you will be recruiting IT professionals to fill various contract positions for OST’s fortune 500 clients, especially within the Canadian banking sector. You will analyze current and prospective staffing requirements, prepare job advertisements, screen and interview potential job applications., , A successful candidate will be an experienced individual who thrives on delivering top-level Technical candidates with the goal of continuously enhancing client relationships and generating a qualified pipeline of applicants for current and future client engagements. You will guide job applicants on employment requirements and on terms and conditions of employment such as short term, long term and fulltime project-based engagements., You will review candidate inventories on several job boards such as Monster, Indeed, LinkedIn, Google x ray search engine to contact potential job applicants to arrange interviews and arrange transfers, redeployment and placement of IT technical personnel., , Title: Senior Technical (IT) Recruiter, Location: 550 Queen Street, Toronto, M5A 1V2, Term of Employment: Full-time/Permanent (40 hours/week), Language of work: English, Salary: $55000 to $60000 per year, Benefits: Medical & dental benefits, commissions, possibility to work from home and paid vacation time as per company’s policy, Date posted: Jan 17th, 2020, Deadline: July 17th, 2020, Contact info: epatki@opensystemstech.com, Phone: 647-361-8446, , Your Responsibility Is To Be PRIME, , Personable- You will engage your personality to connect and align with potential clients and candidates; you will reinforce our image as a leading organization of choice. This is included by not limited to:, , Representing our brand and culture to candidates by supporting an organized, engaging, and fun candidate experience, inspiring technical leaders to pursue a career at OST, Establishing relationships with consultants/contractors nationwide, with a variety of clients in both direct manager and VMS settings., , Resourceful: You will maintain the notion that time is money and treat your role as such. You will use the appropriate recruitment methods to fill the client requirements. This includes but is not limited to:, Networking, lead generation, social media sites, and job boards, Developing driving and executing comprehensive search strategies to recruit candidates, Referring job order leads and hiring manager names to Account Managers., , Your Intelligence Includes But Is Not Limited To, , Intelligent- You will learn the Technical language so well that you may attempt to start coding. You will engage with client needs by understanding how each client requirement is imperative to their bottom line., , Leading a full-cycle recruiting process of sourcing, scheduling, interviewing, hiring - and celebrating! - for all open technical positions, Learning and understanding all of OST’s service offerings, Analyzing candidate information to determine matches between candidates and job openings and submitting qualified candidates to open job requirements., , This Includes But Is Not Limited To, , Motivated- In an organization not driven by metrics, motivation is the key to productivity. If you are motivated by a recurring sense of accomplishment, gratitude by recognition or growing commission check, we’ve established the perfect culture for you., , Maximizing your search efforts and methodologies, and continuously making placements to capitalize on your commission earnings., , Excellent- OST’s standard of performance warrants that each employee shares this innate characteristic. One who exhibits excellence will take satisfaction in approaching this very common role in an uncommon way; you will drive the organization and will change lives, Meet or exceed weekly sales goal expectations., , Required Education & Experience, , College, CEGEP or other non-university certificate or diploma from a program of 1 year to 2 years or equivalent experience., 3+ years of IT staffing experience in an agency setting and successful track record of high-volume recruiting for Fortune 500 organizations. Must be able to source, screen and recruit graduates of colleges, universities, other educational institutions, and technical professionals from major financial firms in Canada., 2+ years of IT contractor recruiting experience for the banking sector, especially banking clients that use MSP (Managed Service Provider) / VMS (Vendor Management System) model-based recruiting strategies., Should be able to update applicants of results of selection process and prepare job offers, conduct criminal checks, reference checks, background checks, and credit checks as per client’s internal onboarding requirements., 2+ years of hands-on expertise on Vendor management systems such as SAP Fieldglass and Beeline to manage workforce and interact with the clients. Must advise client managers, contractors and employees on staffing policies, procedures and current market trends on IT market., 2+ years of creating Boolean search strings, Google Xray strings to find well qualified job applicant for Contract and Fulltime/Permanent position., 2+ years of working experience on cloud-based Applicant Tracking System such as Bullhorn to enable staffing and recruitment enterprises to track applicants, manage talent, and organize candidate pipelines, analyze their business dynamics using business intelligence (BI) reports, and map their workflows., , Must be following Full lifecycle recruitment process: understanding job orders, creating job description, posting the job description, sourcing IT consultant within 48 hours from the position being released that includes screening, and conducting phone interviews, skype interviews, and creating skills matrix, formatting resume and presenting the profile to the hiring team., , Strong proficiency with MS Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint and using host of plugins and Chrome extensions related to recruiting., Sense of urgency to increase speed to Canadian tech candidate-market with respect to reach out candidates in highly competitive marketplace., , Must negotiate hourly pay rate, fulltime employee’s salary, benefits etc. with selected candidates and co-ordinate with the human resources administration team to accomplish exit formalities in case termination of contract, and also take surveys, feedback from the previous employees., , Must be Tech Savvy, and have exposure sourcing, building talent pipeline, and placing successful candidates on latest cloud Technologies such as Google Cloud, AWS cloud, Microsoft Azure cloud, and PCF cloud., , Must be able to support end to end recruiting needs for Capital Markets, Retail Banking & Shared Services, Anti-Money Laundering compliance program, Digital – Strategy & Innovation Testing, Data Science and Emerging Technologies, develop alternate sourcing strategies to attract and hire niche technical skills., , Must have a vast network of, and serve clients on IT/Technical requisitions such as Java Full Stack and Back-End Developers, DevOps/Cloud/Bigdata, Hadoop/Engineers, Front-End Web Developers, UX/UI Designers/ Developers, Scrum Master/Agile Coach, Information Security Engineers, Network Analysts & Engineers, Tech Support Engineers, System Admins, Solution Architectures, Project/Program Managers, Business Analysts, Business System Analysts., , Desired Knowledge, Skills & Abilities, , You take the time to provide a positive and meaningful candidate experience, You have a deep understanding of different coding languages, technical stacks, and terminology, You’re passionate about the tech industry and keep a pulse on the latest trends, Change is not scary to you and you thrive in organizations that constantly adapt and evolve, You come to work to get things done and don’t mind taking lead and engaging with those that are running the same race, You understand that the single biggest problem with communication is the illusion that it has taken place, You are P.R.I.M.E: Personable, Resourceful, Intelligent, Motivated & Excellent, , Reasons To Work At OST, , Our team is phenomenal, We service large fortune 500 clients, We invest in growing our people—personally and professionally, You’ll be part of insane growth, If you’re passionate- there’s unlimited room for your career growth!, We have a generous vacation policy & flexible-work options, Health, Dental Insurance coverage, We offer a competitive base salary in addition to a commission plan with no threshold. Simply put, you earn money on every deal you make.
column15:
Open Systems Technologies is a tier-one vendor for the world's most competitive financial and technology companies, offering both fulltime and contract recruiting services across the country. We offer a positive, entrepreneurial, high performing culture where all employees have the unique opportunity to run a full desk. Our office looks, feels, and operates like a start-up, but with the stability, clientele, and resources that only an industry veteran can provide. 

At our core, we are structured to be flexible. With 30 years of experience, OST has been able to stand the test of time and remains the leading provider of IT staffing solutions in NY due to our forward thinking and adaptability through fluctuating job markets and evolving work cultures.

Find all our jobs here - https://www.opensystemstech.com/jobs-search

Open Systems Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions regarding employment will be made without regard to age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, marital status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

column14: Elastic is a search company that powers enterprise search, observability, and security solutions built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Barclays, Cisco, eBay, Fairfax, ING, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe. Learn more at elastic.co, , About The Role, , We are looking for an experienced product leader to be responsible for the growth and go-to-market aspects of Elastic Cloud, Elastic’s rapidly growing hosted service., , We are looking for a person who has helped define the vision and made critical decisions in the evolution of a technology focused SaaS product and has experience in leading a fast growing product offering and a team of Product Managers who are distributed around the world., , What You Will Be Doing, Lead, develop and grow a team of highly skilled Product Managers., Work closely with the Elastic Cloud Engineering Team and Tech leads to define and maintain a shared vision for the future of Elastic Cloud., Drive growth of the service by continuously iterating and improving the user on-boarding and ongoing product experience., Work with upstream product and engineering teams at Elastic to ensure awareness and alignment of the priority and timing of critical features and changes, and their applicability to the Elastic Cloud platform., Collaborate with the Sales & Marketing teams on go-to-market, messaging, competitive analysis and enablement., Collaborate with the Elastic community team on promotional activities for Elastic users across the world., Gather market competitive and trend data, customer and community feedback and usage information to develop product insights, , What You Being Along, You hold a BS degree in Computer Science or bring equivalent technical experience, You bring a minimum of 10 years in Product Management, of which at least 5 years have been spent leading product teams and managing technology focused SaaS products, Excellent written and spoken communications skills, Solid understanding and familiarity with cloud technologies (such as AWS, Azure, and GCP) and developer-focused products, Solid understand of SaaS business models and sales motions, Curiosity and an open mind, Ego-free attitude — we are here for the success of the team and the company, Empathy, transparency, and a good sense of humour, , Experience/interest In Some Of These Areas Would Be Nice, Direct experience with the Elastic Stack, or experience with one or more of the common use-cases for the Elastic Stack, such as application search, logging, metrics, APM, business analytics, security analytics, GIS, etc., Comfort working in a very cross-functional role, with a highly distributed, global team, Open source software and/or commercial open source companies, Experience with products offered both via SaaS and self-managed, Good sense of user experience and design, , #, , Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People, , As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do., , We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do., Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary, Health coverage for you and your family in many locations, Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles, Generous number of vacation days each year, Double your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent), Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love, Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave, , Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.
column15: Elastic (NYSE: ESTC) is a search company. As the creators of the Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash), Elastic builds self-managed and SaaS offerings that make data usable in real time and at scale for use cases like application search, site search, enterprise search, logging, APM, metrics, security, business analytics, and many more. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians working in countries around the world. Learn more at elastic.co.

column14: Business Development Consultant, , About Us, , Dundas Data Visualization is a global leader in the development of advanced data visualization, dashboard and business intelligence solutions. Our outstanding success is reflected in our numerous industry awards and in the rapid adoption of Dundas technologies by Fortune 500 companies around the world. Discover the opportunity to join a dynamic company that fosters the development of its people., , Position Summary, , We are currently looking for a Business Development Consultant (BDC) to join our dynamic and fast growing organization. As a BDC, you will be the backbone of our sales process, responsible for strategically developing and qualifying new revenue opportunities. Successful candidates will have at least 2 years of experience in a sales or business development role within a technology company., , This is a full time position. Work will be conducted on-site at our Toronto, Ontario office. Any potential candidate must be eligible to work in Canada. Work from home option is not available., You understand the value of generating new business opportunities to help fuel the sales pipeline., You have prospecting and CRM experience, preferably in a software organization., You have a deep understanding of how to quickly develop relationships with potential customers and qualify the wants and needs of their organization., You're organized and understand how to research and identify potential new sales accounts., You have at least 2 years of experience in a metrics driven environment and have been successful at qualifying opportunities that helped you achieve quota., You are extremely personable and connect well with people. You are comfortable conducting high-level product conversations with senior executives., You're a storyteller, whose comfortable presenting over the phone and in person., Technology is something that you love and you’re always wanting to learn more about it., You have great written and verbal skills., You're a highly motivated, driven, self-starting individual who knows how to hit the ground running., You thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy developing the role and adapting as the business evolves., Questions about this position, , If you have any questions about this position or our company please feel free to ask; we will be more than glad to ensure you have the information you need. Just e-mail us at click apply., , How to Apply, , Please send an e-mail with your resume to: click apply and note the job title in the subject. If a development test is required for the position, you must also include your finished test in the e-mail., , We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
column15:
Dundas Data Visualization® is a leading, global provider of Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Visualization software providing Dashboards, Reporting and Visual Data Analytics, all through a fully embeddable BI platform. 

Our flexible Dundas BI™ platform can be seamlessly integrated into your existing systems and applications, enabling you to easily access, analyze and visualize any data, on any device, for deeper, faster insights. For over 20 years, Dundas has been helping organizations to make better decisions and achieve greater success.

column14: At Intact, insurance is not about things. It’s about people. It’s what we believe, and it shapes everything we do. It’s why we strive to provide a second-to-none experience for our customers and create an inspiring workplace for our employees to thrive in., , As Canada’s largest provider of property and casualty insurance, we’re not only leading our industry, but we’re redefining what it means to work for it. As a recognized top employer, we’re committed to living our values and supporting our dedicated people who bring their best to work each day because they know their work matters., , Your Job, , Are you an experienced technology lawyer looking to join a world-class, in-house legal department filled with great colleagues and offering an amazing corporate culture? If so, we’re looking for a Senior Legal Counsel to join our team in Downtown Toronto!, , As a Senior Legal Counsel, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on Intact’s delivery of leading and innovative insurance solutions to our customers. This role will be focused on procurement, information technology (IT) and intellectual property (IP)., , Here are a few ways you'll be able to make a difference:, , Providing timely legal advice to the Intact Procurement business team in support of the drafting, negotiation, and management of key supplier contracts (and other associated legal documents), Ensuring that contracts and any related documents are compliant with Intact standards, policies and practices, as well as any applicable legislation, Develop training and tip sheets in respect of procurement/information technology (IT) contracting, and industry trends, Supporting the preparation and assessment of requests for proposals (RFPs), Continuously improving Intact’s practices and templates to ensure they remain “best-in-class”, Identifying potential compliance and security risks while implementing proactive plans to mitigate or minimize such risk, Collaborating with world-class legal colleagues in order to solve novel problems and execute on Intact’s customer-focused vision, , , Your Skills, , A successful candidate should bring the following experience and abilities to this role:, , 8+ years of relevant post-call legal experience in a large law firm or in-house environment, Deep experience negotiating and advising on modern technology supply agreements (such as SaaS, telecommunications, cloud services, technology licensing, and outsourcing agreements) is essential, Strong legal writing, drafting, and communication skills are essential, Strong negotiation and problem-solving skills are essential, Proven ability to build strong professional relationships with colleagues and clients is essential, Proven ability to educate and influence decision makers (with an emphasis on simplifying problems and reducing complexity for decision) is essential, Experience and interest in FinTech, InsurTech, or machine learning/data science would be considered an asset, In-house experience would be considered an asset, Experience working in a regulated industry (financial services, telecommunications or similar) would be considered an asset, Bilingual, French and English would be considered an asset (but is not required), , Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:, , An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work, Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career, Flexibility in how and where you work, A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success, An extensive, flexible benefits package, An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased, A casual ‘dress for your day’ culture that encourages you to be yourself, A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle, , , Closing Statement, , We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, , At Intact, our values guide everything that we do. We celebrate our differences and appreciate our similarities. That’s why we are committed to building an inclusive and inspiring environment for all employees. If you need a specific accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know and we will be happy to provide., , Background Checks, , As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us. We want Intact to be a great place to work! This means that you’ll be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing., , Internal Candidates, , For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants., , Eligibility, , It’s important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made. You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time., , This posting closes on June 18, 2020 at 11:59 pm.
column15:
Intact Financial Corporation (TSX: IFC) is the largest provider of property and casualty (P&C) insurance in Canada and a leading provider of specialty insurance in North America, with close to $10 billion in total annual premiums. The Company has over 13,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than five million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada and the U.S. In Canada, Intact distributes insurance under the Intact Insurance brand through a wide network of brokers, including its wholly-owned subsidiary BrokerLink, and directly to consumers through belairdirect. In the U.S., OneBeacon Insurance Group, a wholly-owned subsidiary, provides specialty insurance products through independent agencies, brokers, wholesalers and managing general agencies. 

Intact Corporation financière (TSX : IFC) est le plus important fournisseur d’assurance incendie, accidents et risques divers (IARD) au Canada et l’un des principaux fournisseurs d’assurance spécialisée en Amérique du Nord, avec près de 10 milliards de dollars de primes annuelles. La société compte plus de 13 000 employés à temps plein et à temps partiel qui servent au-delà de cinq millions de particuliers, d’entreprises, de clients du secteur public et de clients institutionnels, à partir de bureaux au Canada et aux États-Unis. Au Canada, Intact distribue ses produits d'assurance sous la marque Intact Assurance par l'entremise d'un vaste réseau de courtiers, notamment sa filiale en propriété exclusive, BrokerLink, et directement aux consommateurs par l'entremise de belairdirect. Aux États-Unis, OneBeacon Insurance Group, une filiale en propriété exclusive, fournit des produits d’assurance spécialisée par l’entremise d’agences indépendantes, de courtiers, de grossistes et d'agences générales de gestion.

column14: Nomis is a late-stage Silicon Valley / Toronto-based FinTech helping transform the $150 Trillion Global Retail Financial Services market through pricing that is both profitable and personalized. Powered by an ever-expanding data network and cutting-edge tech and data science, our customers - ranging from $1Bn to $1Tn – leverage Nomis’ end-to-end Enterprise Pricing Platform to manage risks, serve consumers and grow profitably through real-time market intelligence, customer analytics, and data-driven price optimization and offer management., , Role Description, , As Senior Product Marketing Manager (PMM), you will be responsible for supporting the Go-To-Market success, and growth of one or more Nomis products and/or industry solutions, through a compelling articulation of product value rooted in customer needs and value-drivers. You’ll do so by understanding customer needs and market problems deeply, working closely with internal partners including Industry SME/Lead, Product Management, Sales and Marketing. You will translate your insights into new messaging and content that you’ll promote through events, campaigns, our own website, and via social media. You’ll monitor the impact of these efforts and optimize your content to improve our demand generation results and our sales effectiveness. You will also support sales teams with messaging and tools to properly position your solutions in the opportunities your content and demand generation efforts have helped create. It is the intent of this position that you quickly become the “go to” expert and spokesperson on your solutions and/or the industries you represent.  , , Detailed Job Responsibilities:, ·      Research: Leverage internal and external sources and direct customer conversations to understand customer pain points and value drivers, as well as our competitive positioning, ·      Writing/Messaging: Message and position assigned solutions through succinct, compelling, well written and descriptive that gets to the heart of the business value., ·      Digital Story Telling: Develop “digital stories” using PowerPoint and other tools to deliver exceptional visuals that compliment exceptional content., ·      Sales Enablement: Support sales team members with optimal ammunition (read presentations, solution briefs and battle cards) to properly position and close opportunities. , ·      Solution Marketing: In marketing a new product area, you’ll think outside the box to incorporate partnerships and service offerings to create complete and compelling offers., ·      GTM / Demand Generation: Work with a network of product strategy, management, and marketing professionals to drive GTM strategies and ultimately, revenue growth. , Required Skills and Characteristics:, ·      Experience:  5+ years of experience in Product Marketing and/or Industry Marketing within a Financial Services Data, Analytical Services or Software company, ·      Industry: Strong understanding of and direct experience marketing to buyers and users in the US Retail Banking and/or US Mortgage industry, ·      MarTech Skills: Able to use latest technology to create compelling content that can be published via both traditional and social media channels. Familiarity with Hubspot is a plus, ·      Cross-Functional Management and Influencing Skills: Ability to credibly influence and manage across, and up and down functions is vital., ·      Multi-Tasking, Organization and Presentation Skills: Ability to be organized and keep lots of diverse activities moving forward at the same time. Exceptional presentation skills. Strong presence with executive audiences.
column15:
Nomis helps retail banks deliver win-win customer engagement through price optimization, customer-centric offers, and omni-channel sales enablement. More than 10,000 bankers worldwide leverage Nomis’ cutting-edge Silicon Valley approach to big data, advanced modeling, and deep analytics to understand and anticipate the demands of their customers, competitor actions, and dynamic market conditions. With experience in over 80 implementations, Nomis has a proven track record of increasing customer and stockholder value, returning more than $300 million to its partner banks every year. Banks currently use Nomis technology to manage more than 270 million accounts and optimize over $1 trillion in banking transactions annually.


We are headquartered in Silicon Valley with offices in Melbourne, Australia, and Toronto. Our customers include 20 of the top 100 banks globally and 10 of the top 40 retail banks in North America.

column14: The role is to plan, and direct daily operations, administration, maintenance, and support efforts of the Core Systems and Storage to ensure Moneris has a robust, scalable, reliable and efficient Infrastructure that supports its business., , Leads, technically, a team that will participate in projects, installation and configuration. As well as support Systems and Storage service offerings, including BAU requests, platform currency and capacity planning., , Oversees daily operations and monitoring of our co-location data centers, Systems and Storage, and Services., , You Will Be Accountable To, Establish and manage Systems and Storage service offerings as well as lead and manage a team of technical System Administrators. Prioritize and assign tasks to team members and ensure all the work assignments are being delivered with acceptable quality and meet SLA, Leads the daily operations, including BUA Service and Change Requests, Incident Investigation / Remediation, and Monitoring of Systems and Services, Participate in and lead projects with development, applications, and operations teams to engineer, deploy, and support technical solutions. Also build the supporting Systems and Storage for core in-house development gateways, transaction and payment processing systems, Participate in establishing and supports the enforcement of technology standards, processes and policies related to Systems and Storage, Provides technical infrastructure support and coordination for escalated incidents and problems from engineering and operations teams. Along with participating in audits as needed whereby producing necessary documentation, reports and explanations, Enforce data security, premises integrity and access procedures as per company security policy. Plus, creating and maintaining necessary documentation related Systems and Storage service offerings, and best practices, Maintains good working knowledge of business application, current infrastructure and future trends. As well as coach and help develop team members, , Your Experience Includes, Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/IT or a related field of study, 5+ years of experience in a lead position. Strong experience with designing and administering Linux and/ or Windows Servers and VMware’s vSphere Platform, Experience with Cloud Platform (e.g. Microsoft Azure or AWS) strongly preferred, Extensive experience with designing and building with at least one of the following technologies (Cisco UCS and/or IBM) and/or Storage (EMC and Netapp), 4+ years of experience with the following technologies: Windows Active Director, Exchange server/O365, Backup software, Clusters, Datacenter architecture, PKI, Single Sign On, Citrix (XenApp, XenDesktop), Experience in building and operating Container platforms using Openshift, Kubernetes, Dockers, etc., Strong experience with scripting, automation, and orchestration technologies, Leadership with ability to lead, mentor, deal with conflict resolution, and guide teams through change and every day challenges. In addition to having exceptional analytical ability to assess the business and technology to facilitate problem solving and collaboration, Excellent presentation and communication skills with the ability to interact with internal and external stakeholders with accuracy and professionalism
column15:
Moneris is Canada's largest provider of innovative mobile, online and in-store payment solutions, processing approximately 3.5 billion transactions every year. We offer hardware, software and business solutions to more than 350,000 merchant locations of every size and industry to help transform the way they grow and operate, in payments and beyond.

Founded in 2000 with over 1,500 employees across Canada, Moneris is a hub of collaborative thinkers who challenge the status quo and are passionate about shaping the future of payments. We believe in winning for our customers by winning with each other, which is why we are committed to investing in our people to provide leading payment solutions for our customers.

If you’re interested in joining our team, please visit our career page at https://moneris.com/careers to view current opportunities.

column14: General Accountabilities:, , Reporting to the Supervisor-Reliability Standards Investigations and Audits, this position performs the core compliance monitoring, investigative, audit and exception application functions which serve to support the enforcement of compliance with reliability standards by Ontario market participants and the IESO. These standards include criteria, rules and standards established by the IESO, the North American Electric Reliability Corporation (“NERC”), and the Northeast Power Coordinating Council (“NPCC”), and include cyber security-related Critical Infrastructure Protection standards., , Key Responsiblities:, , Reliability Standards Compliance Monitoring, Participates, along with staff and contractors, in activities related to mandated grid monitoring, complaint intake, whistleblower referrals and other detection methods, for the purpose of identifying possible breaches of the reliability standards., Participates in activities related to effective monitoring or other detection methods with other business units of the IESO who are also engaged in activities which involve gathering of grid operation or participant information and/or who also make use of this monitoring for their business purposes., Reliability Standards Compliance Investigations, Participates, along with staff and contractors, in the performance of investigations of possible breaches of the more than 1,000 Ontario and North American reliability standards, including information-gathering steps allowed for under the applicable legislation and/or market rules and the making of recommendations as to breaches of these standards., Participates, along with staff and contractors, in the performance of information gathering and analysis which support the recommendation of sanctions for determined breaches of reliability standards, including financial penalties of as high as $1 million per occurrence, and the approval and monitoring of reliability mitigation plans., In respect of these functions, participates in:, the preparation and issuance of formal Notices of Alleged Breach to market participants and the IESO, as applicable, meeting all requirements of this notice obligation under the market rules, evidence gathering, analysis and maintenance, , completion of investigation reports, containing summaries of evidence, breach and sanction assessments,, processes affording investigation targets the opportunity to present views and representations to the VP of MACD,, acquisition and evaluation of mitigation plans in cases of ongoing or potentially recurring breaches,, , Liaises, where applicable, with other government agencies, IESO business units and Legal Services pursuant to various MOUs and protocols., Formulates findings and prepares recommendations to support VP of MACD’s consideration of enforcement rulings, determinations and orders., Adheres to all market rules and administrative law principles governing such investigations of breaches of the rules to provide assurance in respect of IESO and MACD reputational and litigation risk in the event of downstream dispute and litigation of MACD enforcement rulings., , Reliability Standards Compliance Audits, Participates in and, if required, coordinates staff and contractor teams performing compliance audits of market participants in relation to reliability standards in accordance with an annual Compliance Monitoring Plan to be stakeholdered and issued to those participants who are deemed accountable for compliance with these standards, by virtue of their inclusion in the North American Bulk Electric System definition, or who must comply with the Critical Infrastructure Protection cyber-security standards.,  Enforcement Disputes, In coordination with MACD managers and supervisors, and IESO Legal Services, as required, executes the procedures, steps and decisions in the IESO’s dispute resolution process, as it pertains to disputes arising specifically from MACD enforcement determinations and orders related to reliability standards. This includes working with other staff and contractors to participate in good faith negotiations, mediation, arbitration, and/or appeal hearings before the Ontario Energy Board or the provincial courts, including the presentation of evidence and other information related to MACD investigations which have led to such enforcement determinations.,  International Obligations and Coordination, Executes MACD’s processes in accordance with any international or regulatory obligations or understandings with these or other authorities, at a minimum including cooperation agreements with FERC, NERC, NPCC, the Ontario Energy Board (“the OEB”), the National Energy Board (“NEB”) and the MESG.,  Reliability Standards Investigation Framework, Participates in and, if required, coordinates staff and contractor teams in the development of, maintenance of and adherence to a framework governing all of the above processes, including policies, handbooks, guides, procedures, processes, templates, tools and manuals., , Market Leadership, Supports the Supervisor- Reliability Standards Investigations and Audits in providing advice to the government, regulator, and/or other stakeholders on reliability-related environmental considerations, as required., Participates in and, if required, coordinates the development and execution of plans and works with stakeholders and government to develop greater clarity and effectiveness concerning market and compliance issues, as required., Other, Ensures that the confidentiality of data from/about market participants is safeguarded;, Performs other duties as assigned., , Skills Criteria:, 8+ years of professional work experience, University Degree in Law, Engineering, Computer Science, Business or related degree to understand the legislation, policies, procedures, rules and standards governing the Marketplace including those that define the North American reliability standards., Excellent command of the English language, in order to ensure a high quality of customer service in the area of rule enforcement and interpretation, that performance standards are clearly defined and high quality in the design/delivery of appropriate training., Good knowledge of the North American reliability standards governing certain aspects of participation in the Ontario electricity marketplace., Experience in investigative procedures and techniques, case management, litigation and evidence procedures and processes., Experience in power system planning, operation, and cyber security, electrical and/or other utility or financial environment, with focus on such areas as planning, operations, cyber security, contract administration, regulatory and/or enforcement activities., Experience in working in a project management environment, developing business processes and identifying and implementing efficiency and effectiveness improvements. This experience requires a good degree of analytical and reasoning skills., ,  WORKING CONDITIONS, , Normal working conditions involving only occasional absence from home., Please note that IESO has a work from home protocol in effect for all non-essential employees.
column15:
It takes a network of professionals to plan and operate the power grid.

The Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) manages Ontario's power system, meeting Ontario's needs in real-time and by planning for the future. 
 
The IESO’s unique, challenging work environment attracts diverse, highly-educated professionals from engineering, business, finance, economics, information technology, law and social sciences. Follow the IESO to learn more about us and the people who work here. Explore the Careers page to hear from current employees and discover opportunities to be part of an energized, leading-edge team with excellent opportunities for growth and development.

column14: Tenstorrent is helping enable a new era in artificial intelligence (AI) and deep learning with its breakthrough processor architecture and software. The company's mission is to deliver orders of magnitude better performance and efficiency for AI workloads from the datacenter to edge of Cloud by co-designing hardware, software and AI algorithms with our unique technology., , Tenstorrent's architecture scales from datacenter servers to IoT devices with dramatically improved efficiency, flexibility, programmability compared to legacy accelerators including CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs, and TPU-type processors. It is developed by our world-class team with deep expertise in computer architecture, hardware design and verification, systems engineering, compilers, software development, and machine learning algorithms., , Our engineering-based culture is focused on achieving the highest levels of AI innovation across all of Tenstorrent's technical disciplines. We constantly strive to blend best-in-class aspects of integrity, openness, diversity and collaboration throughout the company: from the CEO to the engineering leadership and to the newest employee who may be a recent college graduate. By joining Tenstorrent, you will be an integral part of a highly accomplished and distinguished team that has many years of experience at companies that include AMD, Arm, Intel and NVIDIA, and that thrives on delivering new, innovative products., , Based in Toronto with offices in Austin, Tenstorrent is growing quickly. And, we are proudly backed by top-tier Venture Capital firms including Real Ventures and Eclipse Venture Capital, as well as prominent industry luminaries., , Tenstorrent offers a highly competitive compensation package and benefits, and we are an equal opportunity employer., , Tenstorrent is designing machine learning systems which will re-define the state-of-the art for ML processing in many application areas – from many-chip data center systems to tiny battery powered devices., , As an FPGA design engineer in our System Engineering team, you will be focusing on architecture and design of interconnect solutions for multi-processor systems, as well as FPGA emulation of Tenstorrent's AI processors., , Responsibilities, Participation in next generation deep learning system architecture – a “full stack” effort spanning software, processor and system architecture teams, High speed digital design of new components targeting state of the art Xilinx and Intel FPGAs, Conversion of ASIC designs to FPGA for emulation purposes, Participation in PCB architecture and simulation, Bring up, debug, validation, , Qualifications, Bachelor or Master's in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Expert knowledge of hardware description languages (Verilog/VHDL), Superior analytical and problem-solving skills, Excellent understanding of computer architecture and logic design, Strong understanding of high-speed serial interfaces, Solid programming skills (C, C++, Python, Perl), Experience using lab equipment: high speed oscilloscopes, logic and protocol analyzers, spectrum analyzers, etc., Interest in and understanding of machine learning, Superior verbal and written communication skills
column15:
Tenstorrent is helping enable a new era in artificial intelligence (AI) and deep learning with its breakthrough processor architecture and software. The company’s mission is to deliver orders of magnitude better performance and efficiency for AI workloads from the datacenter to edge of Cloud by co-designing hardware, software and AI algorithms with our unique technology.

Tenstorrent’s architecture scales from datacenter servers to IoT devices with dramatically improved efficiency, flexibility, programmability compared to legacy accelerators including CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs, and TPU-type processors. It is developed by our world-class team with deep expertise in computer architecture, hardware design and verification, systems engineering, compilers, software development, and machine learning algorithms.
 
Our engineering-based culture is focused on achieving the highest levels of AI innovation across all of Tenstorrent’s technical disciplines. We constantly strive to blend best-in-class aspects of integrity, openness, diversity and collaboration throughout the company: from the CEO to the engineering leadership and to the newest employee who may be a recent college graduate. By joining Tenstorrent, you will be an integral part of a highly accomplished and distinguished team that has many years of experience at companies that include AMD, Arm, Intel and NVIDIA, and that thrives on delivering new, innovative products. 

Based in Toronto with offices in Austin, Tenstorrent is growing quickly. And, we are proudly backed by top-tier Venture Capital firms including Real Ventures and Eclipse Venture Capital, as well as prominent industry luminaries. 

Tenstorrent offers a highly competitive compensation package and benefits, and we are an equal opportunity employer.

column14: Aviso Wealth:, , A career with Aviso Wealth means being part of an organization dedicated to your success and career development. It means belonging to a group of talented, energetic professionals who live their values every day. Our amazing people and dynamic culture set Aviso Wealth apart. If you're looking for interesting and challenging work, at a company committed to its people, find out more about what Aviso Wealth has to offer., , The Opportunity:, , We're looking for a Director, Strategic Finance to join our Finance team., , Reporting to the Vice-President, Financial Planning & Analysis, the Director, Strategic Finance is a strategic finance partner delivering exceptional service to our Online Brokerage & Digital Wealth business line. The Director, Strategic Finance provides value-added decision support and works with Online Brokerage & Digital Wealth leaders to develop and implement solutions that achieve strategic priorities and outcomes. Strong business acumen, ability to influence and make sound recommendations as well as build and maintain solid relationships with stakeholders are key success factors in this role. The Director, Strategic Finance is also responsible for providing financial leadership to their assigned line(s) of business relating to the detailed budgeting and forecasting process, partner and/or client pricing decisions and analysis of key business metrics and drivers., , Who you are:, , You take initiative, seeking out and owning opportunities to improve yourself, your team, and our business, You're comfortable in a fast-paced environment, maintaining a keen attention to detail even when under pressure, You thrive in a collaborative environment, sharing your knowledge with your colleagues, and celebrating success as a team, You're a life-long learner, staying current on market events, industry news, and innovative trends and technologies, You believe in sustainable financial strength, and you're committed to long-term wealth solutions., You consider the impact of your actions on your team members, our partners, our clients, and the places where we live and work, What your day looks like:, , Lead and provide financial decision support, including key trends, metrics and business drivers to inform decision making in support of achieving operational and strategic objectives, Act as a key partner to assigned business leaders and executives to develop financial analysis to support the strategic and operational planning process, Analyze complex financial information to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management for decision making purposes, Provide strategic financial leadership and support on product development and pricing decisions., Work with the SVP, Chief Financial Officer, Chief Administrative Officer and the Vice-President, Financial Planning & Analysis to approve all new and changes to pricing decisions and product development, Lead financial analysis for Online Brokerage marketing campaigns to set financial objectives and analyze the effectiveness of campaigns, Lead the annual budget process, forecasting and projections for an assigned line(s) of business, Support continued development of budgeting, financial forecasting, operating plans and modeling tools, Analyze key metrics and drivers to understand variances, identify risks and opportunities and summarize performance at line(s) of business operating committee meetings, Work with the Director, Business Analytics to define business metrics and drivers in support of building business intelligence tools and comprehensive reporting for the organization, Support the Vice-President, Financial Planning & Analysis of the annual development of the Shared Service Model, Support the broader Finance team in aligning financial policies and procedures to achieve organizational objectives, , Requirements:, , Your experience and skills:, , Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field, MBA an asset, Professional designation (CA, CGA, CMA / CPA), A minimum of 10 years progressive experience in financial roles, with at least 5 years as Manager or Director of Financial Planning and Analysis, within the Online Brokerage industry., Experience leading and managing a team, Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Strong understanding of data mining techniques and principles, Market research experience, an asset, Familiarity with enterprise planning tools to facilitate budgeting and forecasting activities, Highly analytical and detail-oriented, Exceptional organizational skills and ability to prioritize and handle multiple simultaneous assignments, Strong interpersonal and leadership skills, Proven ability to anticipate business needs and priorities, working with all levels of management and employees, Superior communication and presentation skills to persuade and influence peers and upper management, Demonstrated willingness to roll-up sleeves and work with team members in a hands-on management capacity, Ability to thrive in a past-paced performance-driven environment, dealing with ambiguity and change, , Benefits:, , At Aviso, you'll find a dynamic, entrepreneurial culture that rewards innovation and celebrates success. We offer a competitive compensation package, career enrichment, and regular social events to foster teamwork. Aviso Wealth welcomes and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including persons with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs in all stages of the hiring process., , , , We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for further consideration will be contacted., , , No recruiters or agencies, please., , , Company Overview:, , , Aviso Wealth is a national, integrated financial services company, with approximately $65 billion in assets under administration and management. Aviso is owned by Credit Union Centrals, CUMIS and Desjardins. Our MFDA-regulated dealer, full-service IIROC-regulated brokerage, and insurance dealer support thousands of financial advisors at hundreds of credit unions across Canada. Our award-winning online brokerage, Qtrade Investor, and our digital advice platform, VirtualWealth, give Canadians flexible choices for building their wealth. Our asset manager, NEI Investments, is a Canadian leader in Responsible Investment funds and portfolios, which are available through a national network of advisors. Aviso also provides custodial services and introducing broker services to independent financial organizations, including banks, trust companies, insurance companies, investment dealers, portfolio managers and financial planning firms. Aviso has major operations in Vancouver and Toronto, along with regional offices across Canada. More information about Aviso Wealth is available at www.aviso.ca.
column15: Aviso Wealth is a national, integrated financial services company owned by the Credit Union Centrals, CUMIS and Desjardins. Our investment and insurance dealers support thousands of financial advisors at hundreds of credit unions across Canada. Our award-winning online brokerage, Qtrade Investor, and our automated investing platform, VirtualWealth, give Canadians flexible choices for building their wealth. Our asset manager, NEI Investments, is a Canadian leader in Responsible Investment funds and portfolios, which are available through a national network of advisors. Aviso also provides custodial services and introducing broker services to independent financial organizations, including banks, trust companies, insurance companies, investment dealers, portfolio managers and financial planning firms. Aviso has major operations in Vancouver and Toronto, along with regional offices across Canada. A career with Aviso means being part of a group of talented, energetic professionals who live their values every day, and belonging to an organization dedicated to your success and career development. If you're looking for interesting and challenging work, at a company committed to its people, apply to join our team.

column14: Req Id: 252191, , At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content - we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate., , If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team., , Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property., , We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, DevOps who has experience productionizing, maintaining, and optimizing cloud-native applications. The successful candidate will help us define, build, and maintain a machine-learning-as-a-service environment at Bell. Our mission is to enable the customer operations team at Bell to iterate quickly on hypotheses, scale their experiments to enterprise datasets, and efficiently productionize highly-available, fault-tolerant machine learning applications. In this role you will work cross-functionally with data scientists and data engineers across the organization to enable Bell to use machine learning to drive business decisions., , Key Responsibilities, Maintain and optimize infrastructure-as-code to apply machine learning methods in production, Act as a subject matter expert as it pertains to application logs, health monitoring, notifications, and automated-DevOps, Maintain and enhance CI/CD pipelines taking into accounting testing, documentation, version tracking, and deployments, Build, automate, and maintain machine learning dependencies and artifact pipelines, Collaborate with product teams to accelerate productivity and maintain product robustness, , Required Competencies, You have experience delivering and maintaining “software-as-a-service” applications via cloud-native architecture, Experience with the following stack or similar is a plus: git/Docker/Kubernetes/REST/Kafka/Python/Java/ELK/Grafana, You are organized and agile; comfortable with ambiguity and able to prioritize and troubleshoot a variety of technical issues, You are familiar with CI/CD pipelines and best practices, You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation, You have development experience with at least one general programming language (e.g. Python, C/C++, Java), You have experience with data processing and storage frameworks like Hadoop, Spark, Redis, HBase, PostgreSQL, You are self-motivated and can demonstrate enthusiasm via personal projects, Kaggle competitions, publications, or presentations at meetups/conferences, Skilled communicator with a proven record of leading projects across disciplines, , Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec., , Additional Information, , Position Type: Management, Job Status: Regular - Full Time, Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Don Mills || Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Quebec : Montreal, Application Deadline: 05/25/2020, , Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted., , At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities., , Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions regarding accessible employment at Bell please email our Diversity & Inclusion Team at inclusion@bell.ca., , Created: Canada, ON, Toronto
column15: Canada’s communications leader for 139 years, Bell continues to transform itself to provide more value to its customers and shareholders. Our goal is to be recognized by customers as Canada’s leading communications company. To achieve it, we rely on the efforts, engagement and expertise of our employees. Our 50,000+ team members are located across Canada, working in thousands of locations in urban and rural areas. Our diverse team is made up of individuals who are highly skilled in a broad range of jobs, working in an environment designed to nurture an engaged workforce and a performance-driven culture. We focus on attracting, developing, and retaining the best talent, as well as creating a positive employee experience that drives effectiveness and high performance in our evolving business environment. Through workplace wellness initiatives – including innovative mental health programs – and by celebrating diversity in the workplace, we reinforce our commitment to create an inclusive atmosphere for all team members.

column14: Montrose Environmental Group, Inc. is an Environmental Services company offering (i) Measurement and Analytical services and (ii) Environmental Resiliency and Sustainability services to a diverse range of clients in industry and government throughout the United States and abroad. Our qualified engineers, scientists, technicians, associates and policy experts are proud of our ability to objectively help industry, the public and regulators work constructively together on environmental opportunities., , Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 8 laboratories servicing air, water, soil and tobacco testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance. For our families and communities, we strive to protect the air they breathe, the water they drink, and the soil on which they live., , Position Responsibilities, Daily monitoring of sample scheduling and ensure that samples are analyzed within EPA’s holding time and clients’ due dates, Routine sample preparation and analysis according to Standard Methods (9223, 9221, 9215, 9230, 5210B, etc...), and CDC methods, Prepares media and reagents, Performs initial review of data, Reviews of QA/QC criteria for batch acceptance, Adheres to Standard Operating Procedures and follow safe work practices, Run daily, monthly, quarterly and annual QC checks on micro equipment, media, supplies and materials, Perform data entry, Perform inventory, thermometers calibration,, Cross trains on inter-department and intra-department levels, Participates in lab’s meetings and focus teams, Work effectively with other departments, Associates degree in Science or related field., 1 year of lab experience (academic or professional) preferred, Familiar with microbiological methods and techniques, Able to accommodate flexible schedule including overtime, after-hours and weekend, Able to work independently and make sound decision, Excellent organization skills and strong communication skills, Montrose Environmental Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age (40 and over), ancestry, color, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), denial of Family and Medical Care Leave, disability (mental and physical) including HIV and AIDS, marital status, medical condition (cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, military and veteran status, national origin (including language use restrictions), race, sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, and sexual orientation., , As permitted by applicable law, employment with Montrose is at-will.
column15:
Montrose Environmental was one of the first to see environmental responsibility as not just an imperative but as a strategic asset. And we’re well ahead of the curve in applying the latest technologies in practical ways to solve difficult environmental challenges.

How? By building a leadership team with exceptional depth of experience and breadth of expertise. By bringing together a wealth of local knowledge that allows us to address homegrown issues across multiple locations. By removing operational roadblocks that stand in the way of streamlined, hassle-free, nation-spanning implementation. And by investing in assets and technologies that will keep us out in front of emerging environmental concerns for years to come.

In short, we approach our job the same way our clients approach theirs: With a sense of urgency, a commitment to adding value, and a stubborn refusal to settle for second-best. All to help the people we partner with identify and seize opportunity.
